Release Note:
Notable Changes

You can now add co-authors to Git commits in the Git pane.
It's now easier to undo and amend your last commit in the Git pane.
You can now push and pull branches more easily from the status bar.
You can now create pull requests from the GitHub pane.
A closed tree view dock is no longer expanded when the 'Auto Reveal' option is enabled.
Clip cursor width  when soft-wrap is on and cursor is at the end of a line.
Restore cursor position correctly after undo/redo when multiple editors are open for the same buffer.
Prevent default editor commands from modifying read-only TextEditors.
Separate the concept of "keyboard enabled" editor state from read-only editor state.
Ensure that files are not opened incorrectly when multiple open requests occur simultaneously.
Improve handling of line endings in Unicode files.
Fixed an issue that causes the dock handle to break when an item is dragged over it.
Clarify deprecation of undo: skip option.


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.26.1...v1.27.0

* [atom/atom#16999 - Prevent default commands from modifying readonly TextEditors](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/16999)
* [atom/atom#17041 - Add Probot lock configuration](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17041)
* [atom/atom#16864 - Convert Dock class to Etch](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/16864)
* [atom/atom#16936 - Fix bug caused by dragging file from desktop through dock handle](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/16936)
* [atom/atom#17056 - Weekly Focus: 2018-04-02](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17056)
* [atom/atom#17070 - Defer component initialization until element is requested](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17070)
* [atom/atom#17089 - Clarify deprecation of `undo: skip` option](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17089)
* [atom/atom#17102 - Weekly Focus: 2018-04-09](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17102)
* [atom/atom#17111 - Bump github package version to 0.13.2](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17111)
* [atom/atom#17126 - atom/github v0.14.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17126)
* [atom/atom#17124 - Separate keyboard enablement from read-only editor state](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17124)
* [atom/atom#17166 - Avoid writing to config file while quitting](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17166)
* [atom/atom#17177 - atom/github 0.14.1](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17177)
* [atom/atom#17208 - Fix white I-beam cursor](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/17208)

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
You can now add co-authors to Git commits in the Git pane.
It's now easier to undo and amend your last commit in the Git pane.
You can now push and pull branches more easily from the status bar.
You can now create pull requests from the GitHub pane.
A closed tree view dock is no longer expanded when the 'Auto Reveal' option is enabled.
Clip cursor width  when soft-wrap is on and cursor is at the end of a line.
Restore cursor position correctly after undo/redo when multiple editors are open for the same buffer.
Prevent default editor commands from modifying read-only TextEditors.
Separate the concept of "keyboard enabled" editor state from read-only editor state.
Ensure that files are not opened incorrectly when multiple open requests occur simultaneously.
Improve handling of line endings in Unicode files.
Fixed an issue that causes the dock handle to break when an item is dragged over it.
Clarify deprecation of undo: skip option.

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Fixed an error that would occur when opening files from Finder on macOS.
Fixed a bug where Atom would auto-update even if auto-updates were disabled.
Fixed the cursor not turning white when using dark syntax themes.
Fixed an issue where packages could cause config file corruption by changing config settings during shutdown.
Fixed a bug in the new system for excluding scopes from spell-check.
Fixed an error that would occur when trying to expand snippets in the git commit message editor.

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Fixed an error that would occur when opening files from Finder on macOS.
Fixed a bug where Atom would auto-update even if auto-updates were disabled.
Fixed the cursor not turning white when using dark syntax themes.
Fixed an issue where packages could cause config file corruption by changing config settings during shutdown.

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Added experimental file system watcher support.
Improved support for git worktrees.
Updated fuzzaldrin-plus across a few packages to get better fuzzy path searching.
Improved file rename detection in the watchPath API.
Initial support for a new Atom project file format.
Package authors can now control the order of context menu items.
Chromium 56's "system-ui" generic font family is now used to load platform-specific system fonts.
Atom's .deb package dependencies have been expanded to enable installation inside headless environments.
Fixed crashes caused by missing USERNAME/USER environment variables.
atom --wait now works correctly with Windows file paths.
User interface polish around typing, scroll wheel scaling, and editor text rendering.
Fixed an issue where panes sometimes do not fill available space.
Syntax grammar updates for language-java, language-javascript, language-php, and language-yaml.

Release Note:
Notable Changes

You can now add co-authors to Git commits in the Git pane.
It's now easier to undo and amend your last commit in the Git pane.
You can now push and pull branches more easily from the status bar.
You can now create pull requests from the GitHub pane.
A closed tree view dock is no longer expanded when the 'Auto Reveal' option is enabled.
Clip cursor width  when soft-wrap is on and cursor is at the end of a line.
Restore cursor position correctly after undo/redo when multiple editors are open for the same buffer.
Prevent default editor commands from modifying read-only TextEditors.
Separate the concept of "keyboard enabled" editor state from read-only editor state.
Ensure that files are not opened incorrectly when multiple open requests occur simultaneously.
Improve handling of line endings in Unicode files.
Fixed an issue that causes the dock handle to break when an item is dragged over it.
Clarify deprecation of undo: skip option.

Notable Changes
You can now add co-authors to Git commits in the Git pane.
It's now easier to undo and amend your last commit in the Git pane.
You can now push and pull branches more easily from the status bar.
You can now create pull requests from the GitHub pane.
A closed tree view dock is no longer expanded when the 'Auto Reveal' option is enabled.
Clip cursor width  when soft-wrap is on and cursor is at the end of a line.
Restore cursor position correctly after undo/redo when multiple editors are open for the same buffer.
Prevent default editor commands from modifying read-only TextEditors.
Separate the concept of "keyboard enabled" editor state from read-only editor state.
Ensure that files are not opened incorrectly when multiple open requests occur simultaneously.
Improve handling of line endings in Unicode files.
Fixed an issue that causes the dock handle to break when an item is dragged over it.
Clarify deprecation of undo: skip option.

Release Note:
Notable changes

Fixed an issue that prevented snippets with nested tab stops from expanding correctly (https://github.com/atom/snippets/issues/266)
Fixed an issue that would sometimes prevent the spell-check package from activating (https://github.com/atom/spell-check/issues/67#issuecomment-377808833)
Release Note Abstract:
Notable changes
Fixed an issue that prevented snippets with nested tab stops from expanding correctly (link)
Fixed an issue that would sometimes prevent the spell-check package from activating (link)

Release Note:
Notable changes

Fixed an issue that sometimes prevented the fuzzy-finder from showing local files when Teletype is installed (https://github.com/atom/fuzzy-finder/pull/343)
Added ability to customize the default timeout used for notifications that automatically dismiss themselves (https://github.com/atom/notifications/pull/182)
Sanitized HTML rendered within notification descriptions (https://github.com/atom/notifications/issues/185)
Fixed an issue where CRLF line endings in Python files resulted in incorrect folding when tree-sitter is enabled (https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/16959)

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Added experimental file system watcher support.
Improved support for git worktrees.
Updated fuzzaldrin-plus across a few packages to get better fuzzy path searching.
Improved file rename detection in the watchPath API.
Initial support for a new Atom project file format.
Package authors can now control the order of context menu items.
Chromium 56's "system-ui" generic font family is now used to load platform-specific system fonts.
Atom's .deb package dependencies have been expanded to enable installation inside headless environments.
Fixed crashes caused by missing USERNAME/USER environment variables.
atom --wait now works correctly with Windows file paths.
User interface polish around typing, scroll wheel scaling, and editor text rendering.
Fixed an issue where panes sometimes do not fill available space.
Syntax grammar updates for language-java, language-javascript, language-php, and language-yaml.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Added experimental file system watcher support.
Improved support for git worktrees.
Updated fuzzaldrin-plus across a few packages to get better fuzzy path searching.
Improved file rename detection in the watchPath API.
Initial support for a new Atom project file format.
Package authors can now control the order of context menu items.
Chromium 56's "system-ui" generic font family is now used to load platform-specific system fonts.
Atom's .deb package dependencies have been expanded to enable installation inside headless environments.
Fixed crashes caused by missing USERNAME/USER environment variables.
atom --wait now works correctly with Windows file paths.
User interface polish around typing, scroll wheel scaling, and editor text rendering.
Fixed an issue where panes sometimes do not fill available space.
Syntax grammar updates for language-java, language-javascript, language-php, and language-yaml.
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Electron has been upgraded to 1.7.11.
Support greatly improved syntax highlighting and code folding with a next-generation parsing system called tree-sitter. See the pull request for details about opting in to try it out.
Dialogs launched with the Atom API, including confirm and save, may now be asynchronous. Add a callback to atom.confirm() and showSaveDialog calls to opt-in to the asynchronous forms.
Python language support is being overhauled substantially and now supports function annotations, async functions, string formatting, f-strings, and binary strings.
style attributes within HTML documents are tokenized as CSS.
The GitHub package has a configuration setting to control automatic hard-wrapping of commit messages composed in the mini-editor.
The GitHub package's diff view no longer scrolls when it shouldn't.
Filemode changes and changes to symlinks are shown and handled properly by git operations.
Duplicate snippet keys are an error and prevent the loading of erroneous user snippets.
The spell-check package supports an excludedScopes setting to prevent spellchecking from being performed on specific grammatical constructs.
Window dimensions are saved on resize rather than blur, which improves reliability.
atom --wait can reuse an existing window and return when the named buffers or folders are closed.
Some TextEditor settings may be preserved when the language mode changes.
atom.commands.dispatch() returns a Promise that resolves after all handlers complete.
Perform all configuration file I/O in the main process, to prevent race conditions that occur when multiple windows interact with the configuration file at once.
Enable snippets within strings and comments.
TypeScript files with a .tsx extension are now discovered by custom transpilers.
Fixed an issue where panes could not be dragged into closed docks.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Electron has been upgraded to 1.7.11.
Support greatly improved syntax highlighting and code folding with a next-generation parsing system called tree-sitter. See the pull request for details about opting in to try it out.
Dialogs launched with the Atom API, including confirm and save, may now be asynchronous. Add a callback to atom.confirm() and showSaveDialog calls to opt-in to the asynchronous forms.
Python language support is being overhauled substantially and now supports function annotations, async functions, string formatting, f-strings, and binary strings.
style attributes within HTML documents are tokenized as CSS.
The GitHub package has a configuration setting to control automatic hard-wrapping of commit messages composed in the mini-editor.
The GitHub package's diff view no longer scrolls when it shouldn't.
Filemode changes and changes to symlinks are shown and handled properly by git operations.
Duplicate snippet keys are an error and prevent the loading of erroneous user snippets.
The spell-check package supports an excludedScopes setting to prevent spellchecking from being performed on specific grammatical constructs.
Window dimensions are saved on resize rather than blur, which improves reliability.
atom --wait can reuse an existing window and return when the named buffers or folders are closed.
Some TextEditor settings may be preserved when the language mode changes.
atom.commands.dispatch() returns a Promise that resolves after all handlers complete.
Perform all configuration file I/O in the main process, to prevent race conditions that occur when multiple windows interact with the configuration file at once.
Enable snippets within strings and comments.
TypeScript files with a .tsx extension are now discovered by custom transpilers.
Fixed an issue where panes could not be dragged into closed docks.

Release Note:
Notable changes

Fixed a bug that prevents dragging a pane to a closed dock (#16863)
Fixed a bug where Atom incorrectly required the USERNAME environment variable to be set (#16823)
Fixed performance and rendering issues in the command palette (atom/command-palette#109, atom/atom-select-list#25)
Release Note Abstract:
Notable changes
Fixed a bug that prevents dragging a pane to a closed dock (#16863)
Fixed a bug where Atom incorrectly required the USERNAME environment variable to be set (#16823)
Fixed performance and rendering issues in the command palette (atom/command-palette#109, atom/atom-select-list#25)

Release Note:
Notable changes

Fixed a bug where atom.showSaveDialogSync() would not return a file path (#16802)
Release Note Abstract:
Notable changes
Fixed a bug where atom.showSaveDialogSync() would not return a file path (#16802)

Release Note:
Notable changes

Fixed a bug that prevented snippets from working when using the Tree-sitter parsing system (#16621)
Fixed a bug that prevented color settings from being saved (#16789)
Fixed a bug that allowed the config file to get corrupted when quitting Atom
Fixed a bug that broke some key bindings on Windows (atom/atom-keymap#232)
Release Note Abstract:
Notable changes
Fixed a bug that prevented snippets from working when using the Tree-sitter parsing system (#16621)
Fixed a bug that prevented color settings from being saved (#16789)
Fixed a bug that allowed the config file to get corrupted when quitting Atom
Fixed a bug that broke some key bindings on Windows (atom/atom-keymap#232)

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Fixed a bug where atom --wait did not work correctly on Windows (#16740)
Fixed a bug that prevented Atom from reusing an existing window when the same path was opened twice (#16764)
Fixed regressions in the behavior of the atom.textEditors.getGrammarOverride and atom.grammars.loadGrammar methods (#16733, #16747)
Fixed several syntax highlighting bugs in the new, experimental tree-sitter highlighting system (#16642, #16643)
Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Fixed a bug where atom --wait did not work correctly on Windows (#16740)
Fixed a bug that prevented Atom from reusing an existing window when the same path was opened twice (#16764)
Fixed regressions in the behavior of the atom.textEditors.getGrammarOverride and atom.grammars.loadGrammar methods (#16733, #16747)
Fixed several syntax highlighting bugs in the new, experimental tree-sitter highlighting system (#16642, #16643)

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Electron has been upgraded to 1.7.11.
Support greatly improved syntax highlighting and code folding with a next-generation parsing system called tree-sitter. See the pull request for details about opting in to try it out.
Dialogs launched with the Atom API, including confirm and save, may now be asynchronous. Add a callback to atom.confirm() and showSaveDialog calls to opt-in to the asynchronous forms.
Python language support is being overhauled substantially and now supports function annotations, async functions, string formatting, f-strings, and binary strings.
style attributes within HTML documents are tokenized as CSS.
The GitHub package has a configuration setting to control automatic hard-wrapping of commit messages composed in the mini-editor.
The GitHub package's diff view no longer scrolls when it shouldn't.
Filemode changes and changes to symlinks are shown and handled properly by git operations.
Duplicate snippet keys are an error and prevent the loading of erroneous user snippets.
The spell-check package supports an excludedScopes setting to prevent spellchecking from being performed on specific grammatical constructs.
Window dimensions are saved on resize rather than blur, which improves reliability.
atom --wait can reuse an existing window and return when the named buffers or folders are closed.
Some TextEditor settings may be preserved when the language mode changes.
atom.commands.dispatch() returns a Promise that resolves after all handlers complete.
Perform all configuration file I/O in the main process, to prevent race conditions that occur when multiple windows interact with the configuration file at once.
Enable snippets within strings and comments.

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Electron has been upgraded to 1.7.11.
Support greatly improved syntax highlighting and code folding with a next-generation parsing system called tree-sitter. See the pull request for details about opting in to try it out.
Dialogs launched with the Atom API, including confirm and save, may now be asynchronous. Add a callback to atom.confirm() and showSaveDialog calls to opt-in to the asynchronous forms.
Python language support is being overhauled substantially and now supports function annotations, async functions, string formatting, f-strings, and binary strings.
style attributes within HTML documents are tokenized as CSS.
The GitHub package has a configuration setting to control automatic hard-wrapping of commit messages composed in the mini-editor.
The GitHub package's diff view no longer scrolls when it shouldn't.
Filemode changes and changes to symlinks are shown and handled properly by git operations.
Duplicate snippet keys are an error and prevent the loading of erroneous user snippets.
The spell-check package supports an excludedScopes setting to prevent spellchecking from being performed on specific grammatical constructs.
Window dimensions are saved on resize rather than blur, which improves reliability.
atom --wait can reuse an existing window and return when the named buffers or folders are closed.
Some TextEditor settings may be preserved when the language mode changes.
atom.commands.dispatch() returns a Promise that resolves after all handlers complete.
Perform all configuration file I/O in the main process, to prevent race conditions that occur when multiple windows interact with the configuration file at once.
Enable snippets within strings and comments.
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Context menus are now asynchronous :tada:.
A new TextBuffer LanguageMode API is being rolled out.
Automatically scroll to the cursor position after folding or unfolding text.
Text editor elements support a readonly attribute.
Create language packages with package-generator.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Context menus are now asynchronous :tada:.
A new TextBuffer LanguageMode API is being rolled out.
Automatically scroll to the cursor position after folding or unfolding text.
Text editor elements support a readonly attribute.
Create language packages with package-generator.

Release Note:
Changes

Update APM to solve inability to upgrade/install packages with case-sensitive names #16478 
Update language-html to remove begin/end matching for alphabetical character references https://github.com/atom/language-html/issues/181
Fix regression with 'Right clicking on selected text deselects the text' #16324
Honor 'never' when chosen in the atom protocol handler registration dialog #16201

Changes
Removed the texteditor isModified/isReadOnly handling intended for unsavable edit buffers due to issues with vim-mode-plus.

Changes

Fixed an uncaught exception in find-and-replace https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/16133
Release Note Abstract:
Changes
Fixed an uncaught exception in find-and-replace link

Release Note:
Notable Changes

ContextMenus are now asynchronous, preserving UI responsiveness while they're visible.
Implemented auto-scrolling when folding/unfolding to keep cursor visible.
Toggling line comments now correctly uses spaces or tabs based on settings.
Implemented new "Select to Next / Previous Bookmark" commands.
Building and rendering the command palette is now perceptibly faster.

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
ContextMenus are now asynchronous, preserving UI responsiveness while they're visible.
Implemented auto-scrolling when folding/unfolding to keep cursor visible.
Toggling line comments now correctly uses spaces or tabs based on settings.
Implemented new "Select to Next / Previous Bookmark" commands.
Building and rendering the command palette is now perceptibly faster.
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Atom packages can register a URI handler function that will be invoked any time the user visits a URI that starts with atom://package-name/
Hide specific commands in the command palette
Improved the performance of multi-cursor editing operations by restructuring event APIs to call their callbacks only once per keystroke
The GitHub package now never locks the index, making it easier to use the CLI or other Git tools with Atom open in the background


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Atom packages can register a URI handler function that will be invoked any time the user visits a URI that starts with atom://package-name/
Hide specific commands in the command palette
Improved the performance of multi-cursor editing operations by restructuring event APIs to call their callbacks only once per keystroke
The GitHub package now never locks the index, making it easier to use the CLI or other Git tools with Atom open in the background

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Fixed a performance problem in the autocomplete system that caused lag when typing long sequences of the same character (https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/44), (https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/45).
Fixed an error that would occur when attempting to use jQuery DOM objects as tooltips (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/16144).
Fixed a bug that caused errors when using sub-word motion commands in vim-mode-plus (https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/43).

Notable Changes

Fixed an error that would occur when attempting to use jQuery DOM objects as tooltips (link).
Fixed a bug that caused errors when using sub-word motion commands in vim-mode-plus (link).

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Atom packages can register a URI handler function that will be invoked any time the user visits a URI that starts with atom://package-name/
Hide specific commands in the command palette
Improved the performance of multi-cursor editing operations by restructuring event APIs to call their callbacks only once per keystroke
The GitHub package now never locks the index, making it easier to use the CLI or other Git tools with Atom open in the background

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Atom packages can register a URI handler function that will be invoked any time the user visits a URI that starts with atom://package-name/
Hide specific commands in the command palette
Improved the performance of multi-cursor editing operations by restructuring event APIs to call their callbacks only once per keystroke
The GitHub package now never locks the index, making it easier to use the CLI or other Git tools with Atom open in the background
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Made a significant performance improvement fetching git status.
Added a setting to highlight the line number in the gutter when matching brackets.
Markdown preview panes no longer reset their scroll position to the top when the source is saved.
Added a setting for maximum line length before soft wrapping is enforced.
Numerous bug fixes to bundled language grammar packages.
Changed autocomplete-plus default provider to compute suggestions natively and on a separate thread.


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.21.2...1.22-releases

* [atom/atom#15613 - Use the Atom Beta executable to verify startup snapshots when building Beta](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15613)
* [atom/atom#15618 - FIX "softWrapped" appear twice in field extraction](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15618)
* [atom/atom#14495 - Enable MAX_SCREEN_LINE_LENGTH to now be set via a config option](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14495)
* [atom/atom#15440 - Replace pathwatcher w/ bundled watcher to catch created & rename events](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15440)
* [atom/atom#15623 - Upgrade text-buffer for destroy-after-save fix](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15623)
* [atom/atom#15627 - Wait for async onWillDestroyPaneItem handlers before destroying items](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15627)
* [atom/atom#15649 - :arrow_up: bracket-matcher@0.88.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15649)
* [atom/atom#15652 - ⬆️  Update autocomplete-plus to v2.35.10](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15652)
* [atom/atom#15654 - ⬆ github@0.6.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15654)
* [atom/atom#15656 - Restore the fs.existsSync guard in Config](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15656)
* [atom/atom#15669 - :memo: Fix cursor name letter casing](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15669)
* [atom/atom#15683 - Allow atom:// urls to be opened from the command line](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15683)
* [atom/atom#15643 - Wait for async PaneContainer.onWillDestroyPaneItem listeners](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15643)
* [atom/atom#15681 - Notify when deserializing project state for missing directories](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15681)
* [atom/atom#14654 - Improve confirm documentation](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14654)
* [atom/atom#15712 - Update language-html to 0.48.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15712)
* [atom/atom#15740 - Restore a missing "typeof"](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15740)
* [atom/atom#15713 - Update syntax-related code to use new TextBuffer LanguageMode API (part 1)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15713)
* [atom/atom#15750 - Avoid process spawn overhead for refreshing git status](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15750)
* [atom/atom#15759 - Upgrade text-buffer and autosave to avoid spurious saves](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15759)
* [atom/atom#15692 - Pane on did change path](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15692)
* [atom/atom#15777 - Fix mouseup listener cleanup when dragging in text editor](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15777)
* [atom/atom#15760 - Fix faded application icons on macOS 10.13](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15760)
* [atom/atom#15769 - :arrow_up: electron@1.6.14](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15769)
* [atom/atom#15799 - Preserve indentation when toggling comments on whitespace-only lines](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15799)
* [atom/atom#15800 - Fix rendering bug when folds cause the vertical scrollbar to disappear with soft wrapping enabled](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15800)
* [atom/atom#15821 - Clear dimensions cache when approximate screen line count changes](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15821)
* [atom/atom#15828 - Clear the dimensions cache after updating the soft wrap column](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15828)
* [atom/atom#15833 - Always revert to composition checkpoint, even if input is disabled](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15833)

Notable Changes
Made a significant performance improvement fetching git status.
Added a setting to highlight the line number in the gutter when matching brackets.
Markdown preview panes no longer reset their scroll position to the top when the source is saved.
Added a setting for maximum line length before soft wrapping is enforced.
Numerous bug fixes to bundled language grammar packages.
Changed autocomplete-plus default provider to compute suggestions natively and on a separate thread.

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Made a significant performance improvement fetching git status.
Added a setting to highlight the line number in the gutter when matching brackets.
Markdown preview panes no longer reset their scroll position to the top when the source is saved.
Added a setting for maximum line length before soft wrapping is enforced.
Numerous bug fixes to bundled language grammar packages.


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

1.21.0...1.22.0-beta0

* [atom/atom#15613 - Use the Atom Beta executable to verify startup snapshots when building Beta](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15613)
* [atom/atom#15618 - FIX "softWrapped" appear twice in field extraction](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15618)
* [atom/atom#14495 - Enable MAX_SCREEN_LINE_LENGTH to now be set via a config option](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14495)
* [atom/atom#15440 - Replace pathwatcher w/ bundled watcher to catch created & rename events](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15440)
* [atom/atom#15623 - Upgrade text-buffer for destroy-after-save fix](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15623)
* [atom/atom#15627 - Wait for async onWillDestroyPaneItem handlers before destroying items](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15627)
* [atom/atom#15656 - Restore the fs.existsSync guard in Config](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15656)
* [atom/atom#15669 - :memo: Fix cursor name letter casing](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15669)
* [atom/atom#15683 - Allow atom:// urls to be opened from the command line](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15683)
* [atom/atom#15643 - Wait for async PaneContainer.onWillDestroyPaneItem listeners](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15643)
* [atom/atom#15681 - Notify when deserializing project state for missing directories](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15681)
* [atom/atom#14654 - Improve confirm documentation](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14654)
* [atom/atom#15712 - Update language-html to 0.48.0](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15712)
* [atom/atom#15740 - Restore a missing "typeof"](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15740)
* [atom/atom#15713 - Update syntax-related code to use new TextBuffer LanguageMode API (part 1)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15713)
* [atom/atom#15750 - Avoid process spawn overhead for refreshing git status](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15750)
* [atom/atom#15759 - Upgrade text-buffer and autosave to avoid spurious saves](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15759)
* [atom/atom#15692 - Pane on did change path](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15692)

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Language Server Protocol support and integration via atom-languageclient and atom-ide-ui.
New filesystem watcher API to unify implementations and conserve system resources.
More PR timeline events and build status are now available in the GitHub pane.
MacOS native tabs are now supported.
Restored Atom's ASAR archive to improve to improve performance in several scenarios, most notably installation on Windows.
Lots of language-specific grammar improvements, including the addition of TypeScript.

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Language Server Protocol support and integration via atom-languageclient and atom-ide-ui.
New filesystem watcher API to unify implementations and conserve system resources.
More PR timeline events and build status are now available in the GitHub pane.
MacOS native tabs are now supported.
Restored Atom's ASAR archive to improve to improve performance in several scenarios, most notably installation on Windows.
Lots of language-specific grammar improvements, including the addition of TypeScript.
All Changes

Lots of language-specific grammar improvements, including the addition of TypeScript.

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Language Server Protocol support and integration via atom-languageclient and atom-ide-ui.
New filesystem watcher API to unify implementations and conserve system resources.
More PR timeline events and build status are now available in the GitHub pane.
MacOS native tabs are now supported.
Restored Atom's ASAR archive to improve to improve performance in several scenarios, most notably installation on Windows.
Lots of language-specific grammar improvements, including the addition of TypeScript.

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Added support for multiple git diff views.
Git commit messages can now be edited in the main editor.
Find in Project search results now include additional context lines.
Added an API for observing dock visibility.
Fixed middle-mouse button behavior when closing tabs on Linux.
CSS autocomplete now supports PostCSS.
Support has been added to bracket-matcher for code embedded in strings.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Added support for multiple git diff views.
Git commit messages can now be edited in the main editor.
Find in Project search results now include additional context lines.
Added an API for observing dock visibility.
Fixed middle-mouse button behavior when closing tabs on Linux.
CSS autocomplete now supports PostCSS.
Support has been added to bracket-matcher for code embedded in strings.
All Changes

Release Note:
This release features a couple of fixes related to editor rendering:

Fixed a regression that prevented lines from being displayed correctly after destroying a marker associated with a block decoration (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15583).
Fixed an issue that caused scrollbars to be in the wrong position when splitting an editor. (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15580)
Release Note Abstract:
This release features a couple of fixes related to editor rendering:
Fixed a regression that prevented lines from being displayed correctly after destroying a marker associated with a block decoration (link).
Fixed an issue that caused scrollbars to be in the wrong position when splitting an editor. (link)

Release Note:
This release features a couple of fixes related to editor rendering:

Fixed a regression that prevented lines from being displayed correctly after destroying a marker associated with a block decoration (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15583).

Release Note Abstract:
This release features a couple of fixes related to editor rendering:
Fixed a regression that prevented lines from being displayed correctly after destroying a marker associated with a block decoration (link).
Fixed an issue that caused scrollbars to be in the wrong position when splitting an editor. (link)

Release Note:
Fixed two issues that were causing the editor to move the cursor when clicking on scrollbars or near the viewport edges (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15515, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15546).
Fixed a regression that prevented the editor from scrolling with a low editor.scrollSensitivity config setting (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15487).
Fixed an issue that prevented scrollbars from showing when the "Show scrollbars only when scrolling" setting was enabled on macOS (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15506).
Fixed a rendering glitch in the editor caused by adding block decorations on invalid markers (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15503, https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15528).
Fixed an uncaught exception that was sometimes thrown when adding block decorations on non-empty markers (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15550).
Fixed a regression that prevented tabs from being closed on middle-click (https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/518).

Atom Core
v1.20.0-beta4...v1.20.0-beta5

Don't select when typing while also holding the left mouse button (atom/atom#15407)
Fix errors with stopped-changing event when buffer is modified in an event listener (atom/atom#15414)
Simplify line node lookup (atom/atom#15420)

v0.67.2...v0.69.0

v13.1.6...13.1.12

v8.0.0...v8.0.1

Include syscall name in TextBuffer IO errors (atom/superstring#29)

Release Note:
1.20.0-beta4 fixes a number of editor-related bugs, including:

atom/atom#15372 - Blurry text on Windows
atom/atom#14765 - File removed outside of Atom does not close tab in Atom regardless of setting
atom/atom#15267 - Mac: No elevation of privilege prompt when attempting to edit files owned by root
atom/atom#15197 - Linux: Middle-clicking an unsaved tab causes entire desktop to be unresponsive to clicks


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.20.0-beta3...v1.20-beta4

* [atom/atom#15346 - Suppress default-prevented composition events on compositionstart instead of compositionupdate](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15346)
* [atom/atom#15345 - Round return values of getMaxScrollTop, getScrollHeight](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15345)
* [atom/atom#15347 - Use capture phase for mouseup handler](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15347)
* [atom/atom#15357 - Ignore scroll requests to NaN, null or undefined positions](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15357)
* [atom/atom#15359 - Fix folding for lines that contain a comment](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15359)
* [atom/atom#15367 - Set visibility: hidden on dummy scrollbars if native ones are invisible](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15367)
* [atom/atom#15228 - Upgrade text-buffer for setTextViaDiff fix](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15228)
* [atom/atom#15372 - Always round GPU layer dimensions to physical pixel boundaries](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15372)
* [atom/atom#15389 - Fix line number position when block decorations are at tile boundaries](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15389)
* [atom/atom#15384 - Fix highlight end pixel position calculation](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15384)
* [atom/atom#15378 - Drop use of GPU tiles for lines and line numbers](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15378)

### [tabs](https://github.com/atom/tabs)

v0.106.2...v0.107.0

* [atom/tabs#515 - Perform left/middle click actions on `click` instead of on `mousedown`](https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/515)

### [text-buffer](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer)

v13.0.9...v13.1.6

* [atom/text-buffer#242 - Don't consider lone CRs as line breaks in setTextViaDiff](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/242)
* [atom/text-buffer#244 - Use native text buffer to check if file is unmodified & to be deleted](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/244)
* [atom/text-buffer#246 - Restore the ability to save files owned by root on Mac](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/246)
* [atom/text-buffer#247 - Fix privilege escalation issues](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/pull/247)

### [node-pathwatcher](https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher)

v7.1.0...v8.0.0

* [atom/node-pathwatcher#122 - Remove privilege escalation functionality](https://github.com/atom/node-pathwatcher/pull/122)

### [superstring](https://github.com/atom/superstring)

v2.0.10...v2.0.12

* [atom/superstring#24 - Avoid changing buffers' modified status when saves fail](https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/24)

Release Note:
1.20.0-beta3 contains another round of fixes for text editor regressions, as well as fixes for bracket-matcher and settings-view.

All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.20.0-beta2...v1.20.0-beta3

* [atom/atom#15310 - Honor editor's `scrollSensitivity` parameter](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15310)
* [atom/atom#15313 - Ensure extra document updates are not scheduled during `updateSync`](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15313)

Release Note Abstract:
Fix bug in Windows installer that prevented our friendly beta community from using Atom 1.20 beta on Windows (atom/atom#15194)
Fix issues with caps lock interfering with keybindings on Windows (link)

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Added support for multiple git diff views.
Git commit messages can now be edited in the main editor.
Find in Project search results now include additional context lines.
Added an API for observing dock visibility.
Fixed middle-mouse button behavior when closing tabs on Linux.
Support has been added to bracket-matcher for code embedded in strings.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Added support for multiple git diff views.
Git commit messages can now be edited in the main editor.
Find in Project search results now include additional context lines.
Added an API for observing dock visibility.
Fixed middle-mouse button behavior when closing tabs on Linux.
Support has been added to bracket-matcher for code embedded in strings.
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Atom's underlying text buffer has been implemented in native C++
Full rewrite of the editor's rendering layer
Update to Electron 1.6.9
Render line number gutter without numbers when showLineNumbers is false
Improved clarity of Editor not responding actions
Restore ability for escape to return focus to center
Optimize trailing whitespace removal using native buffer search


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

Notable Changes
Atom's underlying text buffer has been implemented in native C++
Full rewrite of the editor's rendering layer
Update to Electron 1.6.9
Render line number gutter without numbers when showLineNumbers is false
Improved clarity of Editor not responding actions
Restore ability for escape to return focus to center
Optimize trailing whitespace removal using native buffer search

Release Note:
Atom Core

Ensure custom gutter decoration elements fill their container (atom/atom#15147)

github
v0.3.3...v0.3.4-0

Reduce CPU usage for large repositories (https://github.com/atom/github/issues/959)
Respect GIT_AUTHOR_*/GIT_COMMITTER_* environment variables (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/925)
Fix screenshots in package settings (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1006)
Fix Repository#getGitDirectoryPath() for absent or loading repos (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1031)
Collect an --exec-path from a native git installation, if any (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1057)
Pass credentials correctly when username is provided in the git URL (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1065)
Fix stale function reference when calling context menu handler (https://github.com/atom/github/pull/1072)

Atom Core

Release Note:
Upgrade text-buffer to fix spurious conflict and reload events #15121
Fix gutter decoration regression #15135
Release Note Abstract:
Upgrade text-buffer to fix spurious conflict and reload events #15121
Fix gutter decoration regression #15135

Release Note:
Fix exceptions when measuring pixel positions with pending content updates.
 #15051
Release Note Abstract:
Fix exceptions when measuring pixel positions with pending content updates.
 #15051

Release Note:
Swap underlying editor correctly when calling setModel on editor element (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15013).
Check if incoming element is non-null before attempting to append to it (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/15011).
Fix regressions handling mousedown on Linux and macOS (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/14987)
Release Note Abstract:
Swap underlying editor correctly when calling setModel on editor element (link).
Check if incoming element is non-null before attempting to append to it (link).
Fix regressions handling mousedown on Linux and macOS (link)

Release Note:
Fixed a bug that prevented opening files with non-ascii characters in their names on windows (#14894).
Restored a class that was accidentally removed from decoration elements (#14941).
Restored attributes that were accidentally removed from line number elements (#14941).
Release Note Abstract:
Fixed a bug that prevented opening files with non-ascii characters in their names on windows (#14894).
Restored a class that was accidentally removed from decoration elements (#14941).
Restored attributes that were accidentally removed from line number elements (#14941).

Release Note:
Fixed a crash on Windows when opening some files containing invalid UTF8 content (atom/superstring#16).
Fixed an error when launching Atom on older Linux systems (atom/superstring#16).
Fixed a bug where Atom's custom title bar would sometimes fail to update (#14897).
Fixed rendering issues with the text editor's gutter when using certain packages (#14893).
Fixed rendering issues with block decorations (#14895).
Release Note Abstract:
Fixed a crash on Windows when opening some files containing invalid UTF8 content (atom/superstring#16).
Fixed an error when launching Atom on older Linux systems (atom/superstring#16).
Fixed a bug where Atom's custom title bar would sometimes fail to update (#14897).
Fixed rendering issues with the text editor's gutter when using certain packages (#14893).
Fixed rendering issues with block decorations (#14895).

Release Note:
Fixed a bug where removing trailing whitespace didn't work in files with CRLF line endings.
Fixed a bug where the line ending selector's tooltip sometimes had the wrong text.
Release Note Abstract:
Fixed a bug where removing trailing whitespace didn't work in files with CRLF line endings.
Fixed a bug where the line ending selector's tooltip sometimes had the wrong text.

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Atom's underlying text buffer has been implemented in native C++
Full rewrite of the editor's rendering layer
Update to Electron 1.6.9
Render line number gutter without numbers when showLineNumbers is false
Improved clarity of Editor not responding actions
Restore ability for escape to return focus to center
Optimize trailing whitespace removal using native buffer search


All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

All new Git and GitHub Integration
Improved tokenizing performance via oniguruma caching
Correctly launch Atom from Windows Subsystem for Linux
Added an option to always restore previous session
Added settings for showing context in find-and-replace
Improved suggestions in autocomplete-html


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.17.2...1.18-releases

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
All new Git and GitHub Integration
Improved tokenizing performance via oniguruma caching
Correctly launch Atom from Windows Subsystem for Linux
Added an option to always restore previous session
Added settings for showing context in find-and-replace
Improved suggestions in autocomplete-html
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Restore status bar's ability to display info for files in pending panes (e.g., when single-clicking files in the tree view). https://github.com/atom/status-bar/issues/194
Open the staged and unstaged changes from the context menu when editing a file. atom/github#879
Provide friendlier startup behavior for the GitHub package: add background tips, a Welcome section, and only activate the docks by default once. atom/github#875, atom/github#895, atom/welcome#62, atom/background-tips#30
Show a warning instead of an error when a pull results in merge conflicts. atom/github#877

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Restore status bar's ability to display info for files in pending panes (e.g., when single-clicking files in the tree view). link
Open the staged and unstaged changes from the context menu when editing a file. atom/github#879
Provide friendlier startup behavior for the GitHub package: add background tips, a Welcome section, and only activate the docks by default once. atom/github#875, atom/github#895, atom/welcome#62, atom/background-tips#30
Show a warning instead of an error when a pull results in merge conflicts. atom/github#877

Release Note:
Notable Changes

All new Git and GitHub Integration
Improved tokenizing performance via oniguruma caching
Correctly launch Atom from Windows Subsystem for Linux
Added an option to always restore previous session
Added settings for showing context in find-and-replace
Improved suggestions in autocomplete-html


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
All new Git and GitHub Integration
Improved tokenizing performance via oniguruma caching
Correctly launch Atom from Windows Subsystem for Linux
Added an option to always restore previous session
Added settings for showing context in find-and-replace
Improved suggestions in autocomplete-html
All Changes
Atom Core
v1.17.0-beta5... 1.18.0-beta0

atom/atom#14174 - Avoid errors deserializing 1.17 workspace state in prior Atom versions
atom/atom#14166 - Ensure that atom-panel tags can be created via HTML
atom/atom#14175 - Always focus active pane item when pane is activated
atom/atom#14137 - Document pane item interface on Workspace
atom/atom#14183 - Properly restore focus to center when hiding dock via toggle
atom/atom#14188 - Always search a pane container w/ the given URI in workspace.open
atom/atom#14164 - Add module
atom/atom#14177 - Remove event listeners from correct element
atom/atom#14194 - Require module eagerly
atom/atom#14178 - Prevent the resize handle from covering the center

atom/atom#14221 - Don't close permanent dock items

atom/atom#14261 - Upgrade first-mate to take advantage of oniguruma caching

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Docks
Improved startup time
Fix for middle-mouse-button paste on Linux
Restore the Atom environment when adding project folders to a fresh window
Removal of jQuery from all bundled packages

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Docks
Improved startup time
Fix for middle-mouse-button paste on Linux
Restore the Atom environment when adding project folders to a fresh window
Removal of jQuery from all bundled packages
All Changes
Atom Core
v1.16.0...1.17.0

atom/atom#14024 - Snapshot module
atom/atom#14038 - Optimize style sheets loading
atom/atom#14065 - Fix typo in comments of text-editor-registry.js
atom/atom#13963 - Restore atom environment when adding project folders to a fresh window
atom/atom#13764 - Disable soft wrap on mini editors
atom/atom#14096 - Don't snapshot minimatch and fix package transpilation registry on win32

Release Note:
Pinch and zoom is correctly disabled. #14252
urlOpen has been fixed. #14320
The 'Search in Directory' context menu has been restored in find and replace. #887
Fuzzy finder correctly handles quick text entry again. #288
An uncaught exception from the incompatible package finder has been fixed. #21
Empty space next to tree view items is clickable again. #1075
Release Note Abstract:
Pinch and zoom is correctly disabled. #14252
urlOpen has been fixed. #14320
The 'Search in Directory' context menu has been restored in find and replace. #887
Fuzzy finder correctly handles quick text entry again. #288
An uncaught exception from the incompatible package finder has been fixed. #21
Empty space next to tree view items is clickable again. #1075

Release Note:
Fixed bug where bundled packages were loaded instead of dev packages
Updated to Electron 1.3.15 to address remote module issues https://github.com/electron/electron/pull/9240
Release Note Abstract:
Fixed bug where bundled packages were loaded instead of dev packages
Updated to Electron 1.3.15 to address remote module issues link

Release Note:
Fixed a bug that caused the tree-view to unexpectedly gain focus.
Fixed a bug that prevented the tree-view from showing when adding a project folder.
Fixed a bug that caused the tree-view to initially have the incorrect width.
Fixed a bug where cmd-w would close the tree-view when it was focused.
Release Note Abstract:
Fixed a bug that caused the tree-view to unexpectedly gain focus.
Fixed a bug that prevented the tree-view from showing when adding a project folder.
Fixed a bug that caused the tree-view to initially have the incorrect width.
Fixed a bug where cmd-w would close the tree-view when it was focused.

Release Note:
Fixed a regression that made it impossible to toggle closed docks. (#14203)
Fixed a bug in atom.worskpace.openSync test helper. (#14205)
Release Note Abstract:
Fixed a regression that made it impossible to toggle closed docks. (#14203)
Fixed a bug in atom.worskpace.openSync test helper. (#14205)

Release Note:
Ensure atom-text-editor element is initialized before loading packages (#14194)
Hide dock resize handles when docks are hidden (#14178)
Release Note Abstract:
Ensure atom-text-editor element is initialized before loading packages (#14194)
Hide dock resize handles when docks are hidden (#14178)

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Improved Atom's startup time through the use of V8 custom startup snapshots.
https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13916
Extended Atom's workspace with new Dock system for organizing auxiliary tools.
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13878
https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13977

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Improved Atom's startup time through the use of V8 custom startup snapshots.
link
Extended Atom's workspace with new Dock system for organizing auxiliary tools.
link
link

Release Note:
Notable Changes

More title-bar options on macOS.
Restore the correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI.
Lots of progress in our ongoing effort to remove jQuery from bundled packages.
Add the "dalek" package  to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages that are overshadowing core packages.


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

1.15.0...1.16.0

* [atom/atom#13806 - Overhaul element pool and debug double-free errors](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13806)
* [atom/atom#13808 - Fix code-signing on CircleCI](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13808)
* [atom/atom#13781 - Avoid emitting path change events while destroying the Project](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13781)
* [atom/atom#13817 - Throw exceptions when decorating destroyed marker layers](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13817)
* [atom/atom#13820 - Avoid hangs when opening minified files](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13820)
* [atom/atom#13810 - Restore correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13810)
* [atom/atom#13823 - Upgrade to Babel 6 and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13823)
* [atom/atom#13818 - Return decorations for markers from *all* marker layers from decorationsForScreenRowRange](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13818)
* [atom/atom#13843 - Respect the --resource-path flag](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13843)

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
More title-bar options on macOS.
Restore the correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI.
Lots of progress in our ongoing effort to remove jQuery from bundled packages.
Add the "dalek" package  to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages that are overshadowing core packages.
All Changes
Atom Core
1.15.0...1.16.0

atom/atom#13806 - Overhaul element pool and debug double-free errors

atom/atom#13781 - Avoid emitting path change events while destroying the Project
atom/atom#13817 - Throw exceptions when decorating destroyed marker layers
atom/atom#13820 - Avoid hangs when opening minified files

atom/atom#13823 - Upgrade to Babel 6 and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files

Release Note:
Notable Changes

More title-bar options on macOS.
Restore the correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI.
Lots of progress in our ongoing effort to remove jQuery from bundled packages.
Upgrade the bundled Babel to Babel 6  and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files because the bundled libv8 handles quite a few things natively now.
Add the "dalek" package  to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages that are overshadowing core packages.


All Changes

### [Atom Core](https://github.com/atom/atom)

v1.15.0...v1.16.0-beta0

* [atom/atom#13810 - Restore correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13810)
* [atom/atom#13823 - Upgrade to Babel 6 and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13823)
* [atom/atom#13818 - Return decorations for markers from *all* marker layers from decorationsForScreenRowRange](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13818)
* [atom/atom#13843 - Respect the --resource-path flag](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13843)
* [atom/atom#13754 - Normalize disk drive letter in path on Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13754)
* [atom/atom#13616 - More title-bar options (macOS)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13616)
* [atom/atom#13525 - Add dalek package to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13525)
* [atom/atom#13825 - Relativize spec paths more when reporting](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13825)
* [atom/atom#13875 - :bug: Fix apm shell script reference in Windows](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13875)
* [atom/atom#13918 - Cause an assertion failure if defaultMarkerLayer is destroyed early](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13918)
* [atom/atom#13919 - Throw an error when assertions fail if built from source](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13919)
* [atom/atom#13842 - Updating requires for linux to support 32bit build(For Testing)](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13842)
* [atom/atom#13912 - Remove macOS emoji workaround](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13912)
* [atom/atom#13922 - Convert workspace to JavaScript](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13922)
* [atom/atom#13929 - Fix destroying a `PanelContainer` containing multiple panels](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13929)
* [atom/atom#13945 - Always restore Reopen Project menu, fixes #13758](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13945)
* [atom/atom#13941 - Update languages](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13941)
* [atom/atom#13944 - Fix path on macOS link](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13944)
* [atom/atom#13954 - Convert Panel Container to JavaScript](https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13954)

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
More title-bar options on macOS.
Restore the correct directory's project state when opening a new file from the CLI.
Lots of progress in our ongoing effort to remove jQuery from bundled packages.
Upgrade the bundled Babel to Babel 6  and apply fewer transformations when transpiling babel files because the bundled libv8 handles quite a few things natively now.
Add the "dalek" package  to let people know when they have built-in packages installed in ~/.atom/packages that are overshadowing core packages.
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

Duplicate selections with multiple lines now behaves in a more intuitive way.
Added a core option for closing deleted file tabs, while the default remains keeping these tabs open to prevent potentially losing data.
Show cursor by default on MacOS.
Disable periodic serialization for large buffers to improve performance when editing large files.
Improvements to line tokenization to improve editor performance when opening files with large, uninterrupted lines, like minified JavaScript. Opt out of this behavior from certain grammars like language-gfm.
Remove projects correctly  from the Windows jump list.
Node 6 is now required to build Atom.
Always reserve horizontal space for two digits on the line number gutter to prevent UI jitter when transitioning from 9 lines to 10 lines.
Add a setting to apply the Chromium proxy configuration to apm via env vars.
Show the default value in a tooltip when one is present in the settings view.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Duplicate selections with multiple lines now behaves in a more intuitive way.
Added a core option for closing deleted file tabs, while the default remains keeping these tabs open to prevent potentially losing data.
Show cursor by default on MacOS.
Disable periodic serialization for large buffers to improve performance when editing large files.
Improvements to line tokenization to improve editor performance when opening files with large, uninterrupted lines, like minified JavaScript. Opt out of this behavior from certain grammars like language-gfm.
Remove projects correctly  from the Windows jump list.
Node 6 is now required to build Atom.
Always reserve horizontal space for two digits on the line number gutter to prevent UI jitter when transitioning from 9 lines to 10 lines.
Add a setting to apply the Chromium proxy configuration to apm via env vars.
Show the default value in a tooltip when one is present in the settings view.
All Changes

Release Note:
Atom core changes:
Throw an exception when attempting to decorate a destroyed marker layer. #13817
Fix an exception related to keyboard layouts on certain Linux distros. #13785
Fix an exception that would occur when closing an Atom window. #13781
Fix 'This element has already been freed!' exceptions. #13806
TextBuffer changes:
Ensure that markers are marked as destroyed when their marker layers are cleared via the new MarkerLayer.clear API. atom/text-buffer#203
Fix a rare stack overflow when editing large files. atom/text-buffer#204
Fix an exception when calling DisplayMarkerLayer.findMarkers from a DisplayMarker.onDidDestroy callback. atom/text-buffer#205
Fix regressions in multi-line searches introduced as part of a search optimization.
atom/text-buffer#206
atom/text-buffer#207


Introduce some assertions to help us debug some very rare exceptions. atom/text-buffer#208

Release Note:
Notable Changes

The behavior when duplicating lines when there are multiple selections is now more intuitive.
Atom will now keep open the tab of any file, modified or not, when it's deleted outside the editor. You can turn off this behavior with a new core setting:
  
Cursors remain visible by default when there is a selection. The old behavior of hiding cursors with a selection can be restored via a config setting.
apm now honors system HTTP proxy settings.
Removals from the Jump List on Windows are now handled correctly.
Node 6 is now required to build Atom.


All Changes

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
The behavior when duplicating lines when there are multiple selections is now more intuitive.
Atom will now keep open the tab of any file, modified or not, when it's deleted outside the editor. You can turn off this behavior with a new core setting:
Cursors remain visible by default when there is a selection. The old behavior of hiding cursors with a selection can be restored via a config setting.
apm now honors system HTTP proxy settings.
Removals from the Jump List on Windows are now handled correctly.
Node 6 is now required to build Atom.
All Changes

Release Note:
Notable Changes

A fundamental data structure in the editor has been implemented in native code to reduce memory and yield better performance for large files. More improvements to come.
Atom 1.14 makes available a 64-bit installation for Windows.
Improvements to the MRU tabs UX:
An MRU-ordered list of the tabs to visit now appears during MRU traversal.
There is an option in the tabs package settings to make ctrl-tab and ctrl-shift-tab do MRU or simple left/right traversal.
Fixed a bug in keyup handling such that the MRU order doesn't appear to randomly change.
Overhaul of the bundled C# grammar
Upgrade find-and-replace to use new marker layer API for fast clearing of markers
Option for avoiding overlay movements
Reduce the impact of leaking Editor, Selection, & Cursor objects

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
A fundamental data structure in the editor has been implemented in native code to reduce memory and yield better performance for large files. More improvements to come.
Atom 1.14 makes available a 64-bit installation for Windows.
Improvements to the MRU tabs UX:
An MRU-ordered list of the tabs to visit now appears during MRU traversal.
There is an option in the tabs package settings to make ctrl-tab and ctrl-shift-tab do MRU or simple left/right traversal.
Fixed a bug in keyup handling such that the MRU order doesn't appear to randomly change.
Overhaul of the bundled C# grammar
Upgrade find-and-replace to use new marker layer API for fast clearing of markers
Option for avoiding overlay movements
Reduce the impact of leaking Editor, Selection, & Cursor objects

Release Note:
Various markdown-preview fixes:
Scrolling on core:move-up / core:move-downhttps://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/464
Zooming https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/462
Fix broken syntax highlighting of code blocks https://github.com/atom/markdown-preview/issues/461
Fix scrolling with core:move-up and core:move-down commands in deprecation-cop. https://github.com/atom/deprecation-cop/commit/4d3d32a4cc4a16c04ccd04038faaa0c87c337818
Fix a possible crash in the native Patch implementation. https://github.com/atom/superstring/pull/10
Remove unnecessary dependency in Linux rpm package. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13573
Release Note Abstract:
Various markdown-preview fixes:
Scrolling on core:move-up / core:move-downlink
Zooming link
Fix broken syntax highlighting of code blocks link
Fix scrolling with core:move-up and core:move-down commands in deprecation-cop. link
Fix a possible crash in the native Patch implementation. link
Remove unnecessary dependency in Linux rpm package. link

Release Note:
Fixed a regression that disabled syntax highlighting when converting Markdown to HTML (https://github.com/atom/highlights/pull/49)
Fixed a regression that caused editors to throw exceptions when performing certain kinds of selection (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13687)
Fixed a regression that caused Find and Replace to throw an error after opening and then closing a search result (https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/844)
Solved an issue that caused Atom to throw an exception when setting an invalid font family (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13668)
Solved an issue that sometimes prevented Windows users from submitting deprecation reports (https://github.com/atom/deprecation-cop/pull/78)
Solved a bug that caused the editor's font size to not be increased/decreased when holding Ctrl and moving the mouse wheel (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13667)
Solved a bug in apm that prevented packages with native dependencies from being installed on Atom Beta (https://github.com/atom/apm/pull/673)

Release Note:
Fix exceptions when undoing line movements caused by a bug in Atom's native Patch module.
Ensure command paths on Windows are quoted when containing a '#' edfd7c4eb7a92293a41743130f207c8d6afcecbd
Update APM to ensure paths on Windows are always quoted to handle spaces etc. https://github.com/atom/apm/issues/666
Release Note Abstract:
Fix exceptions when undoing line movements caused by a bug in Atom's native Patch module.
Ensure command paths on Windows are quoted when containing a '#' edfd7c4eb7a92293a41743130f207c8d6afcecbd
Update APM to ensure paths on Windows are always quoted to handle spaces etc. link

Release Note:
Correct beta update URL for Windows so no longer wants to upgrade 1.14.0-beta0 to 1.13.0 #13607
Improve updates panel in settings-view to prevent inconsistent state https://github.com/atom/settings-view/pull/890
Fixed a memory leak in the text buffer's marker system

Note: Windows users will need to manually update to this release.
Release Note Abstract:
Correct beta update URL for Windows so no longer wants to upgrade 1.14.0-beta0 to 1.13.0 #13607
Improve updates panel in settings-view to prevent inconsistent state link
Fixed a memory leak in the text buffer's marker system
Note: Windows users will need to manually update to this release.

Release Note:
Notable Changes
Portable mode
Portable mode is now available on macOS and Linux as well as Windows. Finding an adjacent .atom folder for settings now also takes precedence over the ATOM_HOME environment variable.
Test Suite
Atom's test suite now uses a lot less disk space and cleans up as it runs. It also now runs and passes on x64 Windows.

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Portable mode
Portable mode is now available on macOS and Linux as well as Windows. Finding an adjacent .atom folder for settings now also takes precedence over the ATOM_HOME environment variable.
Test Suite
Atom's test suite now uses a lot less disk space and cleans up as it runs. It also now runs and passes on x64 Windows.

Release Note:
Notable Changes
Reopen Project
Want to get back to that combination of folders you had with the state as you left it?  Check out Reopen Project in the File menu!
Performance
We now have a benchmarking tool suite to help us quantify and help address performance issues.
All Changes
Atom Core
v1.12.9...v1.13.0
- atom/atom#12911 - Add ability to use custom elements inside tooltips
- atom/atom#12937 - Extract signed exe's from nuget-full for portable
- atom/atom#12977 - Don't share overlayDimensions across instances
- atom/atom#12933 - Don't construct placeholder tokenized lines
- atom/atom#12984 - Introducing Atom benchmarks
- atom/atom#12898 - Avoid forcing computation of all screen lines when opening a file
- atom/atom#12991 - Change locally required Python version to 2.7.12

Release Note Abstract:
Notable Changes
Reopen Project
Want to get back to that combination of folders you had with the state as you left it?  Check out Reopen Project in the File menu!
Performance
We now have a benchmarking tool suite to help us quantify and help address performance issues.
All Changes

Release Note:
Upgrade to Electron 1.3.13 which includes several bug fixes including a keybinding fix for Linux users.
Replace libXScrnSaver with libXss.so.1 in RPM package spec, resolving https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13354.
Activate packages immediately if hook had already been triggered.

Release Note:
Fixed a bug in Find and Replace that made Atom throw an exception when writing invalid regular expressions. https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/817
Added support for using SVG elements in block decorations. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13321
Fixed a regression that was preventing Atom from being executed via the command line with the --profile-startup argument. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13288
On Windows, fixed an issue that was causing Atom to not use the system keyboard language when changing it while Atom was open. https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/22
On Windows, solved a problem that was preventing certain keyboard languages (e.g. Saudi Arabian) from being recognized. https://github.com/atom/keyboard-layout/pull/23
On Linux, fixed a regression that made Atom use 100% of a CPU core when launching it from a desktop shortcut or via the GNOME launcher. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13320
On Linux, added a missing dependency to the RPM package that was preventing Atom from being opened when such dependency was not already installed on the system. https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13289

Added support for using SVG elements in block decorations. link
Fixed a regression that was preventing Atom from being executed via the command line with the --profile-startup argument. link

Release Note:
For non-Latin keyboards such as Russian and Hebrew, keystrokes containing modifiers are now resolved with U.S. layout characters for all keys, not just keys with non-Latin keycaps. For example, ctrl-. and ctrl-/ are now typed based on the position of those symbols on a U.S. layout. https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/179
On Windows, dead keys now resolve to dead for binding purposes instead of their corresponding character. This is because looking up the unicode character for a dead key via Windows APIs interferes with the keyboard buffer, causing dead keys not to register for any keystroke in which such a lookup is performed. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13263
Reverted a keymap behavior change in which keystrokes targeting a different DOM element were retargeted to the current focused element because it was causing an infinite recursion in certain edge cases. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13181
Fixed an issue that was preventing syntax highlighting on HTML files from working correctly when an attribute contained ampersands. https://github.com/atom/language-html/issues/141
On Windows and Linux, the shortcut for reloading Atom now works again and it has been changed to ctrl-shift-f5 to avoid conflicts with the symbols-view package. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13267
Release Note Abstract:
For non-Latin keyboards such as Russian and Hebrew, keystrokes containing modifiers are now resolved with U.S. layout characters for all keys, not just keys with non-Latin keycaps. For example, ctrl-. and ctrl-/ are now typed based on the position of those symbols on a U.S. layout. link
On Windows, dead keys now resolve to dead for binding purposes instead of their corresponding character. This is because looking up the unicode character for a dead key via Windows APIs interferes with the keyboard buffer, causing dead keys not to register for any keystroke in which such a lookup is performed. link
Reverted a keymap behavior change in which keystrokes targeting a different DOM element were retargeted to the current focused element because it was causing an infinite recursion in certain edge cases. link
Fixed an issue that was preventing syntax highlighting on HTML files from working correctly when an attribute contained ampersands. link
On Windows and Linux, the shortcut for reloading Atom now works again and it has been changed to ctrl-shift-f5 to avoid conflicts with the symbols-view package. link

For example, ctrl-. and ctrl-/ are now typed based on the position of those symbols on a U.S. layout. https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/179
On Windows, dead keys now resolve to dead for binding purposes instead of their corresponding character. This is because looking up the unicode character for a dead key via Windows APIs interferes with the keyboard buffer, causing dead keys not to register for any keystroke in which such a lookup is performed. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13263
Reverted a keymap behavior change in which keystrokes targeting a different DOM element were retargeted to the current focused element because it was causing an infinite recursion in certain edge cases. https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13181
Fixed an issue that was preventing syntax highlighting on HTML files from working correctly when an attribute contained ampersands. https://github.com/atom/language-html/issues/141
Release Note Abstract:
For non-Latin keyboards such as Russian and Hebrew, keystrokes containing modifiers are now resolved with U.S. layout characters for all keys, not just keys with non-Latin keycaps. For example, ctrl-. and ctrl-/ are now typed based on the position of those symbols on a U.S. layout. link
On Windows, dead keys now resolve to dead for binding purposes instead of their corresponding character. This is because looking up the unicode character for a dead key via Windows APIs interferes with the keyboard buffer, causing dead keys not to register for any keystroke in which such a lookup is performed. link
Reverted a keymap behavior change in which keystrokes targeting a different DOM element were retargeted to the current focused element because it was causing an infinite recursion in certain edge cases. link
Fixed an issue that was preventing syntax highlighting on HTML files from working correctly when an attribute contained ampersands. link

Release Note:
Various default keybindings that used ctrl-alt and a letter have been rebound or removed on Windows and Linux to avoid conflicting with common international glyphs. Full details are below in Default keymap changes
Fixed multiple key bindings issues caused by changes to improve international keyboard support:
Allow ctrl-alt- bindings to shadow the ability to type non-ASCII AltGraph characters on Windows international keyboards. If you need access to non-ASCII symbols that are shadowed by default key bindings you will need to unset! those bindings.
https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/175
https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/174


Fixed keystroke resolution on Windows when caps-lock is enabled.
https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/182


Fixed key bindings interfering with IME text input
https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/172
https://github.com/atom/atom-keymap/issues/177


Fixed path resolution issues with network-mapped paths by upgrading Electron to fix a bug in Node
https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/13104

Default keymap changes (Windows & Linux only)
To avoid conflicts with glyphs on international keyboards the following default keyboard shortcuts have been changed:
- window:reload is now ctrlshiftr
- window:run-package-specs is now ctrlshifty
- application:add-project-folder is now ctrlshifta
- editor:fold-selection is now ctrlaltshift[
- autoflow:reflow-selection is now ctrlshiftq
We have also had to remove two that collide where no reasonable alternative mapping could be found. They are provided here in cson format so that if you want to re-enable them you can paste them into your own keymap.cson file:
``` cson
'atom-workspace atom-text-editor:not([mini])':
  'ctrl-alt-z': 'editor:checkout-head-revision'
'atom-workspace atom-text-editor':
  'ctrl-alt-shift-p': 'editor:log-cursor-scope'
```
macOS users are unaffected as they do not use ctrlalt as a way to generate international symbols.
Please see the customizing keybindings section of the Atom Flight Manual if you want to further reconfigure the default keymappings.

Release Note:
Notable changes

Made large files open more quickly (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12898).
Stopped using the shadow DOM in atom-text-editor elements (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/12903).
Sign and timestamp Windows binaries with SHA256 for help avoid false screening in anti-virus software.
Reopen Project menu to access recently opened folders using the new atom.history api (https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/13046).
