Fixed an issue where apm unpublish would fail when run without a package name

The workspace DOM element now contains the current UI theme name as a CSS class.

Fixed an issue on Mac where the window's title bar would not be visible in certain scenarios.

Fixed an issue where the Styleguide would not open.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue where certain property names were parsed as selectors in Sass files.
The maximized state of the window is now properly restored on launch.
The number of selected characters is now displayed in the status bar.
Removed deprecation warnings from the autoflow package.
Removed deprecation warnings from the open-on-github package.
The language-mustache package is now bundled by default.
Image links in Markdown files are now colorized correctly.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue in the archive file viewer where errors were not shown and it would appear that loading was stuck.
Add a button to the Incompatible Packages view that reloads Atom and rechecks all the installed packages for compatibility. This is also available from the command palette.
@at-root directives in Sass files are now colorized correctly.
Custom element selectors such as my-element in Sass files are now colorized correctly.
The editor:checkout-head-revision command now confirms before running the check out. This confirmation can be disabled from the Settings view.
Fixed an issue where apm publish --tag would log an error and fail to complete.
Fixed an issue where apm stars would log an error and fail to list the starred packages.
The title bar on Mac OS X now shows the icon for the active file and is selectable to open the Finder to a folder in the path.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an issue in the archive file viewer where errors were not shown and it would appear that loading was stuck.
Add a button to the Incompatible Packages view that reloads Atom and rechecks all the installed packages for compatibility. This is also available from the command palette.
@at-root directives in Sass files are now colorized correctly.
Custom element selectors such as my-element in Sass files are now colorized correctly.
The editor:checkout-head-revision command now confirms before running the check out. This confirmation can be disabled from the Settings view.
Fixed an issue where apm publish --tag would log an error and fail to complete.
Fixed an issue where apm stars would log an error and fail to list the starred packages.
The title bar on Mac OS X now shows the icon for the active file and is selectable to open the Finder to a folder in the path.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Atom's Chrome version has been upgraded from 31 to 36
Atom's Node version has been upgraded from 0.11.10 to 0.11.13
Fixed an issue on Windows where the source map URLs in JavaScript files would be incorrect.
Added apm publish --rename my-new-package-name to publish a package under a new name.
Added apm install --packages-file my-packages.txt to install all the packages listed in a text file.
~~strike through~~ text in Markdown files is now tokenized and given the .strike CSS class.
Fixed an issue where YAML keys would not be colorized correctly when they contained certain valid characters.
Support for number pad keybindings have been removed. Number pad keys will now resolve to their equivalent keystroke as if they were pressed on the main keyboard area. You should remove the num- modifier from any keystrokes in your ~/.atom/keymap.cson file.
<script> tags in HTML files with a template type attribute are now colorized as HTML.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Atom's Chrome version has been upgraded from 31 to 36
Atom's Node version has been upgraded from 0.11.10 to 0.11.13
Fixed an issue on Windows where the source map URLs in JavaScript files would be incorrect.
Added apm publish --rename my-new-package-name to publish a package under a new name.
Added apm install --packages-file my-packages.txt to install all the packages listed in a text file.
~~strike through~~ text in Markdown files is now tokenized and given the .strike CSS class.
Fixed an issue where YAML keys would not be colorized correctly when they contained certain valid characters.
Support for number pad keybindings have been removed. Number pad keys will now resolve to their equivalent keystroke as if they were pressed on the main keyboard area. You should remove the num- modifier from any keystrokes in your ~/.atom/keymap.cson file.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue on Linux where tabs could not be dragged between windows.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an issue on Linux where tabs could not be dragged between windows.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed a major editor performance regression introduced in 0.117.0 when the background of the lines and line numbers was made transparent.
You can now delete a bracket and its matching pair at the same time using ctrl-backspace on Mac and alt-ctrl-backspace on Linux and Windows.
Fixed an issue with the release notes package logging an error when the status bar was disabled.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed a major editor performance regression introduced in 0.117.0 when the background of the lines and line numbers was made transparent.
You can now delete a bracket and its matching pair at the same time using ctrl-backspace on Mac and alt-ctrl-backspace on Linux and Windows.
Fixed an issue with the release notes package logging an error when the status bar was disabled.

Release Note:
Major Changes

ctrl-shift-Z is now mapped to core:redo on Linux.
apm unpublish now supports un-publishing a single package version
apm unpublish my-package@3.0.0
Fixed an issue where else blocks would incorrectly outdent in C/C++ and JavaScript file.
Fixed an issue where the available snippets command would fail after the first opened editor.
Fixed an issue on Linux where Atom would fail to launch when run by two different users.
The Atom .zip file is now 10% smaller and contains 25% fewer files and folders.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Atom now ships with a light version of the Base16 Tomorrow syntax theme.
Added a bunch of new Go snippets.
Fixed an issue where the cursor position would be wrong in themes with bold keywords.
Fixed an issue where the editor would scroll incorrectly when softwrap was enabled.

Major Changes
Atom now ships with a light version of the Base16 Tomorrow syntax theme.

Fixed an issue where the cursor position would be wrong in themes with bold keywords.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The React-based editor is now enabled by default.
Fixed an issue where the editor tabs could be obnoxiously long for certain files.
Added apm star --installed which stars all the packages currently installed to ~/.atom/packages.
Fixed an issue on Windows where the Show In Explorer menu in the Tree view did work correctly for files.
Fixed an issue where certain keybindings would not display in the Settings view.
Fixed an issue where apm publish would log an uncaught exception on connection errors.
%<> style strings are now colorized correctly in Ruby files.
Added  a Convert Spaces To Tabs command available from the Packages > Whitespace menu.
Code blocks wrapped in two backticks are now colorized correctly in Markdown files.
ctrl-shift-home and  ctrl-shift-end now select to the top and bottom of the editor on Windows.
Comments at the end of YAML lines are now colorized correctly.
Fixed an issue in the Tree view where the root folder would have no label when it was the root of the filesystem.
Fixed an issue on Windows where all files opened from a network drive would be empty.
ctrl-shift-Z is now mapped to core:redo on Windows.
Fixed several .gitignore pattern matching issues by upgrading to libgit2@0.21.0
Fixed an issue on Linux where script/grunt mkdeb would fail with a permissions error.

Release Note:
Major Changes

JavaScript regular expressions inside arrays are now colorized correctly.
Anonymous subclasses in CoffeeScript are now colorized correctly.
You can now auto-insert a closing XML/HTML tag using alt-cmd-. on Mac OS X and alt-ctrl-. on Linux and Windows.
%{}, %(), and %[] style strings are now colorized correctly in Ruby files.
Regular expressions passed as arguments to methods are now colorized correctly in Ruby files.
The Settings view now displays a warning when installing a package fails on Windows and Visual Studio and Python can't be successfully detected.
Added a context menu to the Tree view to open the Markdown preview for the selected file.
Fixed an issue causing <!doctype> tags from being escaped and rendered in the Markdown preview.
Fixed an issue causing the focused Markdown preview not to close when the toggle command was run.

Major Changes

Fixed an issue with the YAML colorization being incorrect for nested keys.
Added a apm install --check command that compiles a sample native module to verify the installed build toolchain can compile modules with C/C++ code.
apm install no longer requires Visual Studio to be installed on Windows. Packages will dependencies on modules with native code will still fail to install though if Visual Studio isn't installed locally.
The output of apm -v now includes the installed versions of Git, Visual Studio, and Python.
script/build now supports a --install-dir option to configure where to install Atom to.
script/bootstrap now supports a --no-quiet option to output the full error messages when installing modules.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an issue with the YAML colorization being incorrect for nested keys.
Added a apm install --check command that compiles a sample native module to verify the installed build toolchain can compile modules with C/C++ code.
apm install no longer requires Visual Studio to be installed on Windows. Packages will dependencies on modules with native code will still fail to install though if Visual Studio isn't installed locally.
The output of apm -v now includes the installed versions of Git, Visual Studio, and Python.
script/build now supports a --install-dir option to configure where to install Atom to.
script/bootstrap now supports a --no-quiet option to output the full error messages when installing modules.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing strings with escaped quotes in YAML files to not be parsed correctly.
Added support for viewing symbols for .sass and .yml files using cmd-R
The active grammars are now loaded immediately at startup removing the color flicker for open editors.
ctrl-pageup/ctrl-pagedown now switches to the previous/next editor.
~~~ code blocks are now parsed correctly in Markdown files.
Removed delete option from tree view. move to trash and cancel are now the only options.
Fixed multiline string syntax highlighting for Python.
Add recursive directory expanding/collapsing to Tree View
It is now possible for a grammars to tokenize a newline.
The fuzzy finder now supports an option to traverse into symlinked directories.
Added a Convert Tabs To Spaces command that replaces all hard tabs (\t) with spaces using the configured tab length.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes

The active grammars are now loaded immediately at startup removing the color flicker for open editors.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Required .dll files are now bundled with the app on Windows.
Multiline bold and italic blocks are now colorized correctly in Markdown files.
Fixed an issue causing the Tree view to continue to resize even after releasing the mouse button.
Single line if/else/while/for/do statements in C, C++, and JavaScript files now correctly indent and outdent.
shift-pageup and shift-pagedown now select a page of text upwards or downwards.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Required .dll files are now bundled with the app on Windows.
Multiline bold and italic blocks are now colorized correctly in Markdown files.
Fixed an issue causing the Tree view to continue to resize even after releasing the mouse button.
Single line if/else/while/for/do statements in C, C++, and JavaScript files now correctly indent and outdent.
shift-pageup and shift-pagedown now select a page of text upwards or downwards.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an encoding issue when saving the Markdown preview to HTML.
Fixed an issue when installing packages that had symlinked .bin scripts.
Hard tabs now correctly align to proper tab stops.
The Editor now has a deleteToEndOfLine API
The EditorView now has a editor:delete-to-end-of-line command.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an encoding issue when saving the Markdown preview to HTML.
Fixed an issue when installing packages that had symlinked .bin scripts.
Hard tabs now correctly align to proper tab stops.
The Editor now has a deleteToEndOfLine API
The EditorView now has a editor:delete-to-end-of-line command.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The archive viewer now works on Windows.
Fixed an issue causing the bracket matching highlights to be in the wrong location when code was folded.
When commenting/uncommenting the current selection, non blank lines are not considered when uncommenting.
Autocomplete-plus and vim-mode now work with the React editor.
Gutter decorations are rendered in the React editor.
Fixed a problem where the React editor would crash when reading files containing null bytes.
The Symbols view now supports Ruby methods that end in ? and !.
The new file is now opened in an editor after duplicating from the Tree view.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing an exception to occur when closing the last tab in panes.

Major Changes

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed focus bug in react editor.
Added classic copy/paste keybindings to Linux and Win32.
Updates to Atom Shell v0.13.0.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed focus bug in react editor.
Added classic copy/paste keybindings to Linux and Win32.
Updates to Atom Shell v0.13.0.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Added API support for creating submenus in context menus.
Fixed the auto indenting behavior of HTML tags.
Fixed a text selection bug in the react editor.
C/C++ fenced code blocks are now highlighted correctly when editing/previewing Markdown.
The often misspelled repitition has been updated in all included grammars and themes to now correctly be repetition. This misspelled version was previously used in the CSS, PHP, and Ruby grammars.
There are 3 new apm commands for supporting starred packages on atom.io
apm stars to list or install starred packages, see apm help stars for more information.
apm star to star a package or theme, see apm help star for more information.
apm unstar to unstar a package or theme, see apm help unstar for more information.
apm test now works on Windows.
Fixed an issue on Windows causing Atom to crash when the spec window was closed.
Fixed an issue on Windows causing Atom to not open correctly in dev mode.
Fixed an issue on Windows where box (missing) characters would display in the command palette and background tips.
alt-1 through alt-9 can now be used to switch to a specific tab on Linux.
The available snippets can now be shown using alt-shift-S.
The bundled Atom core specs can now be run without having the atom/atom repository cloned.
Fixed an issue causing the bracket matcher to highlight the wrong HTML tags in certain cases.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Added API support for creating submenus in context menus.
Fixed the auto indenting behavior of HTML tags.
Fixed a text selection bug in the react editor.
C/C++ fenced code blocks are now highlighted correctly when editing/previewing Markdown.
The often misspelled repitition has been updated in all included grammars and themes to now correctly be repetition. This misspelled version was previously used in the CSS, PHP, and Ruby grammars.
There are 3 new apm commands for supporting starred packages on atom.io
apm stars to list or install starred packages, see apm help stars for more information.
apm star to star a package or theme, see apm help star for more information.
apm unstar to unstar a package or theme, see apm help unstar for more information.
apm test now works on Windows.
Fixed an issue on Windows causing Atom to crash when the spec window was closed.
Fixed an issue on Windows causing Atom to not open correctly in dev mode.
Fixed an issue on Windows where box (missing) characters would display in the command palette and background tips.
alt-1 through alt-9 can now be used to switch to a specific tab on Linux.
The available snippets can now be shown using alt-shift-S.
The bundled Atom core specs can now be run without having the atom/atom repository cloned.
Fixed an issue causing the bracket matcher to highlight the wrong HTML tags in certain cases.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue preventing files containing a colon (:) from being opened from the command line.
Fixed a tree view bug that caused it to scroll when up or down were pressed.
apm publish now works when run on Windows.
The bracket matcher package now matches HTML/XML tags.
The applyEndPatternLast property in language grammar patterns is now supported.
You can now add keybindings that target the number pad using the num- prefix.
The bracket matcher package now autocompletes “smart” ‘quotes’.

Major Changes
Fixed an issue preventing files containing a colon (:) from being opened from the command line.
Fixed a tree view bug that caused it to scroll when up or down were pressed.
apm publish now works when run on Windows.

The applyEndPatternLast property in language grammar patterns is now supported.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue with certain keybindings not mapping correctly on Windows and Linux due to a Chromium bug.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an issue with certain keybindings not mapping correctly on Windows and Linux due to a Chromium bug.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Added editor:move-to-beginning-of-previous-paragraph and editor:move-to-beginning-of-next-paragraph commands.
Downgraded the bundled atom-keymap module due to regressions in vim-mode keybindings.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Added editor:move-to-beginning-of-previous-paragraph and editor:move-to-beginning-of-next-paragraph commands.
Downgraded the bundled atom-keymap module due to regressions in vim-mode keybindings.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Key bindings now properly recognized in Dvorak-Qwerty mode.
Various bindings that weren't recognized properly in Linux are now fixed.
The React editor is much more stable, but it's not yet feature-complete.
apm now respects the proxy and SSL settings in your ~/.atom/.apmrc file, this file can contain the same config settings as npm.
apm install can now install multiple packages at once
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Key bindings now properly recognized in Dvorak-Qwerty mode.
Various bindings that weren't recognized properly in Linux are now fixed.
The React editor is much more stable, but it's not yet feature-complete.
apm now respects the proxy and SSL settings in your ~/.atom/.apmrc file, this file can contain the same config settings as npm.
apm install can now install multiple packages at once

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing project symbols to not display when pressing cmd-shift-r with no open editors.
f3 and shift-f3 now perform a find next/previous in the find and replace view on Linux.
ctrl-g now opens the go to line prompt on Linux.
Autocomplete now works when there are multiple selections.
apm now supports a ~/.atom/.apmrc file used as the --userconfig argument to spawned npm commands.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an issue causing project symbols to not display when pressing cmd-shift-r with no open editors.
f3 and shift-f3 now perform a find next/previous in the find and replace view on Linux.
ctrl-g now opens the go to line prompt on Linux.
Autocomplete now works when there are multiple selections.
apm now supports a ~/.atom/.apmrc file used as the --userconfig argument to spawned npm commands.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing the auto updater to show an error dialog.
apm now has a docs command that opens a package's homepage in the browser that is also aliased to apm home and apm open.
Comment blocks at the top of files no longer affect the soft/hard tab settings.
Filenames containing only numbers can now be opened.
Copy/Paste with multiple selections is more intuitive.
Packages can be updated from dev builds.

Major Changes
Fixed an issue causing the auto updater to show an error dialog.
apm now has a docs command that opens a package's homepage in the browser that is also aliased to apm home and apm open.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Update the feedback package.
Remove beta language from welcome package.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Update the feedback package.
Remove beta language from welcome package.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Atom now has a new icon
Snippets now support having multiple tab stops with the same id (i.e $1) will trigger multiple cursors/selections.
Fixed an issue causing errors to be logged when saving the local keymap file.
Added an apm outdated command that lists the packages that have available updates.
Indentation is now preserved correctly when commenting lines.
Double-clicking whitespace now correctly selects the entire block of whitespace.
The atom.workspace.open API now supports an initialColumn option for the column to place the cursor at in the opened file.  You can also use this from command line such as atom package.json:2:4 would open the package.json file and put the cursor on 4th character of the 2nd line.
You can now use cmd-alt-up to return to your previous location after jumping to a location using cmd-alt-down.
The atom CLI now supports a --safe option that will prevent packages from ~/.atom/packages and ~/.atom/dev/packages from loading in the opened window.
The markdown preview now correctly renders HTML included directly in the markdown.
Fixed an issue causing Atom to hang when editing files that had grammars that used token classes that did not translate to valid CSS selectors.
The Settings view now lists all the available package updates in the Packages section.  There is also a status bar icon showing how many installed packages have updates available.
Atom no longer makes itself the default editor for many filetypes.
apm now requires an atom.io token for publishing, you can enter your token by running apm login.

Major Changes

Indentation is now preserved correctly when commenting lines.
Double-clicking whitespace now correctly selects the entire block of whitespace.

You can now use cmd-alt-up to return to your previous location after jumping to a location using cmd-alt-down.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue in the settings view where the value would reset after you cleared the text input field.
Fixed an issue causing the indent guide to render incorrectly on certain lines.
The markdown preview rendered HTML can now be copied to the clipboard or saved to a file.
The atom.workspaceView.eachEditorView(callback) API no longer includes mini editors.

Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing the compile cache to be stored in ~/ instead of ~/.atom
Fixed an issue causing Makefiles containing .PHONY: rules to freeze when typing

Major Changes

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing arguments to apm that contained spaces to be parsed incorrectly.
apm develop now supports a second argument that is the directory to clone the package into.
The editor now properly scrolls when moving lines up/down using cmd-ctrl-up/down.
The cache for comipled CoffeeScript, CSON, and LESS files is now stored in ~/.atom/compile-cache instead of /tmp/atom-compile-cache preventing issues when using Atom across two accounts on the same machine.
JavaScript ES6 generators are now syntax highlighted properly.
Fixed an issue causing apm update and apm install to fail in certain cases when installing native modules .
Deprecated method calls can be viewed with the deprecation-cop:view command.
Escaped unicode characters in CSS and LESS files are now syntax highlighted correctly.

Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing the selection to be wrong when clicking and dragging after previously double clicking on a word.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Atom now launches a new untitled window when the dock icon is clicked and there are no active windows.
Python fenced code blocks in markdown files are now highlighted correctly.
Fixed an issue causing errors to be logged when opening file names containing % characters.
Fixed an issue causing menu item separators to be removed for menus with multiple separators in them.
The open-on-github package now supports submodules.
The inside marker invalidation strategy was renamed to touch, and the new inside invalidation strategy is now exclusive of the start/end, read more in atom/text-buffer#17 and atom/text-buffer#18

Major Changes

Release Note:
Major Changes

Status bar now displays branch name and ahead/behind commit counts for project when no editors are open.
Fixed an issue with backspacing to beginning of word not working in certain cases when on the first line of a file.
YAML is now syntax highlighted in Markdown files using yml or yaml fenced code blocks.
Comments are now inserted at the correct indent level when commenting lines of only whitespace.
The insert newline above command now always indents to the level of the line where the cursor is when the editor.autoIndent config is set to true.
Reserved keywords are now colorized in CoffeeScript files.

Fixed an issue causing the tabs package to load slowly.
Fixed an issue causing C++ files to freeze when editing code with a namespace block.
Fixed an issue causing Makefiles to freeze when editing certain keywords.
Fixed an issue with certain regexes in CoffeeScript files not syntax highlighting correctly.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Tabs can now be dragged between windows.
Fixed an issue causing certain buttons not to work in the installed packages section of the Settings view.
Key bindings can now be disabled with the unset! directive.
Added an Open CHANGELOG button to the installed packages section of the Settings view.
Fixed a memory leak in the whitespace package that was degrading performance over time.

More performance improvements for typing.

Fixed an issue causing spell check underlines from not updating when soft wrap was enabled.
Fixed an issue causing the bracket matcher highlights from not updating when the editor text changed.
Added support for \r line endings.
CoffeeScript regexes now have improved syntax highlighting similar to JavaScript regexes.

Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing the new editor.lineHeight config option from making mini editors have no padding.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes

Release Note:
Major Changes

The status bar now shows the correct branch and commit information for files inside Git submodules.
Fixed an issue causing snippets to not expand depending on text the preceded the snippet prefix being expanded.
An editor.lineHeight config option has been added that controls the line height CSS property of editor views, the default value is 1.3.
Clojure files are now supported by the symbols-view, cmd-r.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
The status bar now shows the correct branch and commit information for files inside Git submodules.
Fixed an issue causing snippets to not expand depending on text the preceded the snippet prefix being expanded.
An editor.lineHeight config option has been added that controls the line height CSS property of editor views, the default value is 1.3.
Clojure files are now supported by the symbols-view, cmd-r.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Line diffs, Tree view status indicators, and checkout HEAD revision now work for files inside Git submodules.
The problem with the find-and-replace mini editors disappearing, which we thought we solved on the last release, should actually be fixed now.
If the keymap encounters a native! binding, it always allows the browser to handle the keyboard event even if there are longer ambiguous matches.
Typing performance has been improved.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Line diffs, Tree view status indicators, and checkout HEAD revision now work for files inside Git submodules.
The problem with the find-and-replace mini editors disappearing, which we thought we solved on the last release, should actually be fixed now.
If the keymap encounters a native! binding, it always allows the browser to handle the keyboard event even if there are longer ambiguous matches.
Typing performance has been improved.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed an issue causing mini editors to be uncomfortably small in places such as the find and replace view.
Downloads counts now display in the Settings view when searching packages and themes.
Fixed an issue causing an error to be logged when pasting in the tree view when nothing was previously copied.
Git support now works properly for projects with a .git file instead of a .git folder.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Fixed an issue causing mini editors to be uncomfortably small in places such as the find and replace view.
Downloads counts now display in the Settings view when searching packages and themes.
Fixed an issue causing an error to be logged when pasting in the tree view when nothing was previously copied.
Git support now works properly for projects with a .git file instead of a .git folder.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The keymap now waits for a timeout when a keystroke sequence exactly matches one key binding and partially matches others.
You can now apply editor styles that change the line height and character width without messing up cursor positioning and softwrap calculations.
Atom now uses the integrated GPU rather than the discrete GPU, improving battery life.
apm search now supports a --packages and --themes option to return only those results.
The whitespace after the cursor is now preserved when entering a newline with auto-indenting enabled.

Major Changes

apm search now supports a --packages and --themes option to return only those results.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Fixed a bug causing the active editor to change when dragging a selection over a tab.
Fixed a bug causing find and replace to throw errors when searching for text contained in an untitled buffer.
Fixed a bug causing atom -h and  atom -v to print out warnings from Chromium.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The fuzzy finder (cmd-t) now has the previously active editor at the top of the list when opened
The atom command now supports opening paths that contains spaces
The symbols view (cmd-r) now shows symbols based on the selected grammar instead of file extension
Tokenization is now faster for lines that do not contain any multi-byte characters
The pane:close event now properly closes the pane when triggered
Packages with empty activation events are now activated immediately
The autosave package will only save when the file is modified
The tree view has duplicate and copy/cut/paste commands
The atom cli command doesn't assume the Atom.app is in /Applications
Fixed occasional exceptions duplicating lines.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The editor:duplicate-line command has been renamed to editor:duplicate-lines. It can now handle multiple multi-line selections.
The persistent: false option is now honored for markers.
Content Security Policy has been enabled in Atom to prevent accidentally running inline scripts in rendered content.
Tabs now correctly focus the editor when clicked.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
The editor:duplicate-line command has been renamed to editor:duplicate-lines. It can now handle multiple multi-line selections.
The persistent: false option is now honored for markers.
Content Security Policy has been enabled in Atom to prevent accidentally running inline scripts in rendered content.
Tabs now correctly focus the editor when clicked.

Release Note:
Major Changes

Hyperlinks and TODO/FIXME blocks now properly highlight in untitled editors
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Hyperlinks and TODO/FIXME blocks now properly highlight in untitled editors

Release Note:
Major Changes

The markdown preview can now be toggled for untitled editors
The markdown preview now updates as you type, no more saving required
The bracket matcher package now properly indents when hitting enter when your cursor is between {}, [], etc.
PHP snippets are now working
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
The markdown preview can now be toggled for untitled editors
The markdown preview now updates as you type, no more saving required
The bracket matcher package now properly indents when hitting enter when your cursor is between {}, [], etc.
PHP snippets are now working

Release Note:
Major Changes

Soft-wrapped lines are no longer hidden by the scrollbar.
Fixed buggy behavior when soft-wrapped lines contained hard tab characters.

API Changes

The path returned from atom.packages.getApmPath() must now be spawned using a BufferedProcess instead of a BufferedNodeProcess.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
Soft-wrapped lines are no longer hidden by the scrollbar.
Fixed buggy behavior when soft-wrapped lines contained hard tab characters.
API Changes
The path returned from atom.packages.getApmPath() must now be spawned using a BufferedProcess instead of a BufferedNodeProcess.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The autocomplete:attach has been renamed to autocomplete:toggle to be more accurate and consistent with other package events
The fuzzy finder now supports ignoring extensions such as *.class
The tree view now supports hiding extensions such as *.class
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
The autocomplete:attach has been renamed to autocomplete:toggle to be more accurate and consistent with other package events
The fuzzy finder now supports ignoring extensions such as .class
The tree view now supports hiding extensions such as .class

Release Note:
Major Changes

The Go language is now supported in the Symbols view (cmd-r)
apm now comes bundled with node preventing version inconsistencies with the locally installed node
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
The Go language is now supported in the Symbols view (cmd-r)
apm now comes bundled with node preventing version inconsistencies with the locally installed node

Release Note: Restored broken links in the guide building a package.
Release Note Abstract: Restored broken links in the guide building a package.

Release Note:
Major Changes

The fuzzyFinder.ignoredNames config setting has been renamed to fuzzy-finder.ignoredNames so that the config namespace matches the package name. Existing settings should be updated to use the new name

Bug Fixes

Fixed occasional errors when editing with folded lines.
Fixed occasional lockups when switching tabs with certain themes.
Fixed a bug where you couldn't open multiple unsaved buffers.
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
The fuzzyFinder.ignoredNames config setting has been renamed to fuzzy-finder.ignoredNames so that the config namespace matches the package name. Existing settings should be updated to use the new name
Bug Fixes
Fixed occasional errors when editing with folded lines.
Fixed occasional lockups when switching tabs with certain themes.
Fixed a bug where you couldn't open multiple unsaved buffers.

Release Note:
Major Changes

:bug: The version of npm bundled with apm has been upgraded to fix a SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN error when installing packages that have dependencies that are published to npmjs.org
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
:bug: The version of npm bundled with apm has been upgraded to fix a SELF_SIGNED_CERT_IN_CHAIN error when installing packages that have dependencies that are published to npmjs.org

Release Note:
Major Changes

apm login now supports sending 2FA codes over SMS
Whitespace is now ignored in fuzzy filtered queries such as cmd-t and cmd-shift-p
:bug: Fixed an issue with find and replace failing when there was an untitled dirty buffer
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
apm login now supports sending 2FA codes over SMS
Whitespace is now ignored in fuzzy filtered queries such as cmd-t and cmd-shift-p
:bug: Fixed an issue with find and replace failing when there was an untitled dirty buffer

Release Note:
Major changes

:bug: Fixed a bug when viewing a disabled package in the Settings view
:bug: Fixed a bug when running apm update and apm init with missing arguments
Release Note Abstract:
Major changes
:bug: Fixed a bug when viewing a disabled package in the Settings view
:bug: Fixed a bug when running apm update and apm init with missing arguments

Release Note:
Major Changes

:chart_with_upwards_trend::watch: The symbols view can now load large tags files (100k+ tags)

API Changes

fs and _ are no longer available from require 'atom'. You should depend on these explicitly via a dependency in your package's package.json file
Release Note Abstract:
Major Changes
:chart_with_upwards_trend::watch: The symbols view can now load large tags files (100k+ tags)
API Changes
fs and _ are no longer available from require 'atom'. You should depend on these explicitly via a dependency in your package's package.json file

Release Note:
For Users

:gift::bug: Several soft wrapping bugs have been fixed
:lock_with_ink_pen::computer: Atom now prompts for a password when saving files that require admin privileges

For Developers

The File and Directory classes previously available from require 'atom' are now available from the pathwatcher module via {File, Directory} = require 'pathwatcher'
Release Note Abstract:
For Users
:gift::bug: Several soft wrapping bugs have been fixed
:lock_with_ink_pen::computer: Atom now prompts for a password when saving files that require admin privileges
For Developers
The File and Directory classes previously available from require 'atom' are now available from the pathwatcher module via {File, Directory} = require 'pathwatcher'

Release Note:
For Users

:lock_with_ink_pen::bug: Fixed an issue with spell check corrections not working properly
:left_right_arrow::computer: Use cmd-k cmd-up/down/left/right to change focus between panes
:pencil2::wave: The init script has been remamed to ~/.atom/init.coffee, you should rename your ~/.atom/user.coffee file after updating
:new::mag: cmd-0 now resets Atom to use its default editor font size

For Developers

The atom.pasteboard global has been renamed to atom.clipboard
Theme's package.json files should how contain a theme key with either a value of "syntax" or "ui".  This affects how the Atom settings view groups with either the syntax or UI themes
The sync and immediate options to atom.packages.activatePackage have been removed.  atom.packages.activatePackage now returns a promise..
Squirrel is now used as the auto updater, previously Sparkle was used

For Users

:pencil2::wave: The init script has been remamed to ~/.atom/init.coffee, you should rename your ~/.atom/user.coffee file after updating
:new::mag: cmd-0 now resets Atom to use its default editor font size

The atom.pasteboard global has been renamed to atom.clipboard
Theme's package.json files should how contain a theme key with either a value of "syntax" or "ui".  This affects how the Atom settings view groups with either the syntax or UI themes
The sync and immediate options to atom.packages.activatePackage have been removed.  atom.packages.activatePackage now returns a promise..
Squirrel is now used as the auto updater, previously Sparkle was used

:necktie::tada: GitHub Enterprise repos are now supported when running GitHub commands such as opening history and blaming

:recycle::eyes:  Changes to ~/.atom/snippets.cson automatically reload, no more refreshing required
:pencil2::wave: The default user stylesheet has been remamed to ~/.atom/styles.css, you should rename your ~/.atom/user.css file after updating
:new::green_heart:  The app icon is now the color green

For Developers

:coffee::one::seven:  Upgraded to CoffeeScript 1.7.0
:honey_pot::honeybee: The exported SelectList class was renamed to SelectListView

For Users

Release Note:
For Users

:new::key: cmd-l selects the current line and pressing it again expands the selection to the next line
:new::key: cmd-shift-l splits a multi-line selection into multiple single-line selections
:new::key: cmd-d finds and selects the next occurrence of the selected word or word under the cursor
:new::key: cmd-ctrl-g finds and selects all occurrences of the selected word or word under the cursor
:new::key: cmd-ctrl-alt-l reloads Atom (used to be cmd-ctrl-alt-r)
:new::key: ctrl-g goes to a specific line number (used to be cmd-l)
:new::key: ctrl-shift-l changes the current grammar (used to be cmd-shift-l)
:new::key: The Git/GitHub related commands now use the alt-g prefix instead of ctrl-g, such as alt-g up to move to the previous diff and alt-g b to blame the current file.
:mag_right::dash: Fuzzy finder now opens quicker and filters in a third of the time
:syringe::fax: Syntax highlighting is now much faster, over 50% faster for JavaScript files specifically
:non-potable_water::non-potable_water: Fixed some major issues with memory consumption. GC pauses should be less frequent now
:arrows_counterclockwise::eyes: Changes to ~/.atom/keymap.coffee automatically reload, no more refreshing required
:hourglass::gun: Packages now activate faster decreasing Atom's startup time

For Developers

atom.on 'uncaught-error' will trigger when an uncaught Javascript error is thrown.
Added WorkspaceView::prependToTop/Right/Bottom/Left and WorkspaceView::appendToTop/Right/Bottom/Left for adding tool panels. This is available via the atom.workspaceView global.

Release Note:
For Users

:black_nib::high_brightness: HTML entities now highlight in GitHub Flavored Markdown files.
:recycle::bug: Fixed an issue with the fuzzy finder re-indexing incorrectly when reopening.
:twisted_rightwards_arrows::id: The wrap-guide package now uses wrap-guide as its config prefix instead of wrapGuide to be consistent with other packages. All wrapGuide.columns config settings should be updated to wrap-guide.columns.
:evergreen_tree::mountain_cableway: Tree view no longer automatically shrinks and expands as your open/close folders.
:evergreen_tree::ghost: The tree-view.hideIgnoredNames settings can now be used to hide file/folders in the tree view that match the core.ignoredNames setting, such as .git.
:chart_with_upwards_trend::bug: Fixed an issue with the editor-stats package not opening.
:evergreen_tree::toilet: Fixed and issue with folders collapsing in the tree-view when a file/folder was added.
:runner::fire: The Movement menu has been removed.

For Developers

:tent::bug: Fixed an issue with the menu file generated from running Package Generator: Generate Package or apm init --package not being parseable.
:do_not_litter: Added a script/clean command to delete node_modules, apm cache, compile cache, etc.
Release Note Abstract:
For Users
:black_nib::high_brightness: HTML entities now highlight in GitHub Flavored Markdown files.
:recycle::bug: Fixed an issue with the fuzzy finder re-indexing incorrectly when reopening.
:twisted_rightwards_arrows::id: The wrap-guide package now uses wrap-guide as its config prefix instead of wrapGuide to be consistent with other packages. All wrapGuide.columns config settings should be updated to wrap-guide.columns.
:evergreen_tree::mountain_cableway: Tree view no longer automatically shrinks and expands as your open/close folders.
:evergreen_tree::ghost: The tree-view.hideIgnoredNames settings can now be used to hide file/folders in the tree view that match the core.ignoredNames setting, such as .git.
:chart_with_upwards_trend::bug: Fixed an issue with the editor-stats package not opening.
:evergreen_tree::toilet: Fixed and issue with folders collapsing in the tree-view when a file/folder was added.
:runner::fire: The Movement menu has been removed.
For Developers
:tent::bug: Fixed an issue with the menu file generated from running Package Generator: Generate Package or apm init --package not being parseable.
:do_not_litter: Added a script/clean command to delete node_modules, apm cache, compile cache, etc.

Release Note:
For Users

:mouse::bug: Fixed a bug causing incorrect cursor movement and text insertion in files with hard tabs \t.
:floppy_disk::bug: Fixed a bug with autosaving causing an error for untitled buffers that had unsaved changes..
:link::bug: Help > Documentation menu now opens correct URL.
:door::bug: Fixed a bug preventing the Settings View: Change Themes command from opening.
:dart::straight_ruler: Added ctrl-g down/up keyboard shortcuts to jump to the next/previous diff hunk in the open editor.

For Developers

New atom.getGitHubAuthToken() and atom.setGitHubAuthToken(token) APIs to access and change the GitHub OAuth token stored in the keychain, see #1240.
Syntax themes can now specify a syntax-variables.less file similar to ui-variables.less, see #1246.

For Developers

For Users

For Users

.cson is now a valid grammar extension.

For Users

Release Note:
For Users

:non-potable_water: :racehorse: Faster startup and plugged some memory leaks
:dash::white_large_square: Atom can now be built on Windows
:star::key: Store user keymaps in ~/.atom/keymap.cson
:ghost::bug: Command palette (cmd-p) no longer missing events when no editors are open
:hash::exclamation: Files starting with #!/usr/bin/env node now highlight as JavaScript by default
:speech_balloon::bug: Commenting lines no longer deletes the first character of the line
Release Note Abstract:
For Users
:non-potable_water: :racehorse: Faster startup and plugged some memory leaks
:dash::white_large_square: Atom can now be built on Windows
:star::key: Store user keymaps in ~/.atom/keymap.cson
:ghost::bug: Command palette (cmd-p) no longer missing events when no editors are open
:hash::exclamation: Files starting with #!/usr/bin/env node now highlight as JavaScript by default
:speech_balloon::bug: Commenting lines no longer deletes the first character of the line

Release Note:
For Users

:link: Links to collaboration URLs now properly open.
:rocket: Launching Atom from the dock now opens an untitled editor.
:file_folder:  Project subfolders now open in a new window when opened from the command line.
:deciduous_tree: Tree view no longer hides Git ignored files when the current project is a subfolder in a Git repository.
:speedboat::dash: Much improved scrolling/cursor performance.
:globe_with_meridians: Menus to expose most of Atom's functionality.
:no_entry_sign: Atom no longer crashes on large files (warns for files larger than 1 MB) or when loading broken packages.
:key: Default keybindings now closely mirror Sublime.

For Package Developers

You can now have a urlMain in your package.json which will be used as the bootstrap script for all urls opened with your package name as the host, such as atom://collaboration/12345.
You can now add menu items to global menus by specifying the appropriate information in cson menu files included in your menus directory like so:

coffeescript
'menu': [
  {
    'label': 'View'
    'submenu': [
      {
        'label': 'Toggle Treeview'
        'command': 'tree-view:toggle'
      }
    ]
  }
]
- Upgraded jQuery to 2.0.3
- If you're currently using {_} = require 'atom' and then calling _.nextTick you should use node's setImmediate instead.
- Packages are now hosted on atom.io so you'll need to remove the publishConfig key from your package.json and replace it with "private": true (which is a precaution to prevent packages from accidentally being published to npmjs.org).
Release Note Abstract:
For Users
:link: Links to collaboration URLs now properly open.
:rocket: Launching Atom from the dock now opens an untitled editor.
:file_folder:  Project subfolders now open in a new window when opened from the command line.
:deciduous_tree: Tree view no longer hides Git ignored files when the current project is a subfolder in a Git repository.
:speedboat::dash: Much improved scrolling/cursor performance.
:globe_with_meridians: Menus to expose most of Atom's functionality.
:no_entry_sign: Atom no longer crashes on large files (warns for files larger than 1 MB) or when loading broken packages.
:key: Default keybindings now closely mirror Sublime.
For Package Developers
You can now have a urlMain in your package.json which will be used as the bootstrap script for all urls opened with your package name as the host, such as atom://collaboration/12345.
You can now add menu items to global menus by specifying the appropriate information in cson menu files included in your menus directory like so:
coffeescript
'menu': [
  {
    'label': 'View'
    'submenu': [
      {
        'label': 'Toggle Treeview'
        'command': 'tree-view:toggle'
      }
    ]
  }
]
- Upgraded jQuery to 2.0.3
- If you're currently using {} = require 'atom' and then calling .nextTick you should use node's setImmediate instead.
- Packages are now hosted on atom.io so you'll need to remove the publishConfig key from your package.json and replace it with "private": true (which is a precaution to prevent packages from accidentally being published to npmjs.org).

Release Note:
For Users

Fix :bug: using the GitHub: Open (ctrl-g o) command
Release Note Abstract:
For Users
Fix :bug: using the GitHub: Open (ctrl-g o) command

Release Note:
For Users

Fixed a :bug: in collaboration where joining a session would fail.
Added ctrl-g c (GitHub: Copy Url from cmd-p) which copies a GitHub URL to the clipboard for the current file and line number.
Release Note Abstract:
For Users
Fixed a :bug: in collaboration where joining a session would fail.
Added ctrl-g c (GitHub: Copy Url from cmd-p) which copies a GitHub URL to the clipboard for the current file and line number.

Release Note:
For Users

Renaming/deleting files/folders is now possible from the tree view context menu.
Find and replace highlights matches correctly for long lines.
Find and replace now stores the history of what you replaced and where you searched.
Collaboration no longer errors when you try to start it from project with no Git repository.
Errors no longer popup when you start Atom and you aren't online.

For Package Developers

apm test is now available, to quickly run atom tests from the command line. Note atom must still be installed and accessible from your command line for this to work.
:closed_book: API Change, globals are deprecated and should now be accessed from the atom object. See #881 for details.

For Users
Renaming/deleting files/folders is now possible from the tree view context menu.
Find and replace highlights matches correctly for long lines.
Find and replace now stores the history of what you replaced and where you searched.
Collaboration no longer errors when you try to start it from project with no Git repository.
Errors no longer popup when you start Atom and you aren't online.
For Package Developers
apm test is now available, to quickly run atom tests from the command line. Note atom must still be installed and accessible from your command line for this to work.
:closed_book: API Change, globals are deprecated and should now be accessed from the atom object. See #881 for details.

Release Note: Safely ignore non-existent themes.
Release Note Abstract: Safely ignore non-existent themes.

Release Note:
For Users

Numerous speedups, atom should load more quickly now.
Collaboration is now working (and accepts 2FA logins).
Brand new find and replace package
Substantially faster for large code bases
Update search results in real-time
Project search and replace
Themes are now packages, so you can install them from apm.
You can open a file at a specific line from the command line, like so atom file.js:10
IME support for international users.
Right click on a spelling correction to bring up suggestions.
The solarized-dark-syntax theme is now included by default.
The base16-tomorrow-dark-theme theme is also included.
There is a new timecop package which allows you to investigate slow packages.
Double-clicking between a word/non-word boundary now selects the word rather than the adjacent non-word characters.

For Package Developers

:closed_book: Changed API, public classes are now exported using a single require statement, {Editor} = require 'atom'
:green_book: Added an API, the menus folder allows packages to specify their own context menu commands.
Default themes are now based on bootstrap and contain ui-variables so that 3rd party themes can better integrate with base UI themes. 
apm init now allows for the generation of packages and themes
ui-demo package for seeing what ui styles are available for use.

How you can help

We'd really like feedback regarding collaboration. If you find a bug, please file an issue on the atom/collaboration repository. If you have a question or a suggestion feel free to drop into the atom chat room and ask away.
